text:
The space is quite large considering I've never seen too many people at once in any venue within their shopping mall. There is a bar at the outside corner with about 8 stools inside and a counter facing out for take away beverages, plus a number of 2- and 4-top tables throughout and another high top long table with 10 seats. Ordering is a bit confusing; there were a few iPads at the front on a stand in a self-ordering section, but they weren't working the day of my visit so I was guided to one of the registers alongside them. The drink station is way in the back corner of the restaurant next to a large rack of their unlabeled generic hamburger buns and cases of beer. The menu features quite a selection of pre-designed burgers, dogs, virgin and spiked shakes as well as several types of fries. Also, for a place with the word 'ketchup' in its name, you'd expect a larger selection than the four that I was able to choose from, with one being generic ketchup flavor.

Trying to keep my burger fairly simple to sample what they're capable of, I went with the mushroom Swiss burger: Angus beef patty, grilled mushrooms, caramelized onions, Swiss cheese and mayo. Upon first bite I was able to identify a completely generic beef patty; it was cooked ok but tasted like something you'd get at a ballpark and not what you'd expect for a 'premium' burger bar. The onions completely overpowered most of the flavors, and were a bit undercooked for my taste. The bun looked overdone, but was actually fresh and pretty good considering its generic presence. The half-melted cheese didn't have a great presence, and the mushrooms were probably less noticeable than the mayo. Overall there was nothing good about this burger.

The fries were of the slightly thick cut, definitely generic frozen variety. They were seasoned with your typical fry seasoning and totally undercooked. Also the oil flavor was possibly a little foul even considering this was fairly early in the day. Not only was the burger and fries not great, but this meal with a drink came to a whopping $16.19! I don't remember being told what my total was at the time of ordering, and wasn't even given a receipt after my purchase. I usually come at these meals ready to spend whatever it takes to do my review, but when I logged into my account later to see the amount I was shocked based on what I was given. Evaluating this meal on that price is bad enough, but when you consider that BurGR is just down the hall in the casino, I could not recommend that you buy a burger here.
Stopped in after  Vegas the Show. ...had classic  burger and a beer ...10.99...burger tasty...not a big selection on draft...had shock top ...kinda of a sports bar.....not bad
Went on a Saturday morning at 11. Place was empty but the servers were friendly.  Used an Amazon Local voucher. Good food. The onion rings were really good!

Price of a Veggie Burger at Ketchup $12
Price of an Earth Burger at GR Burgr $14

Taste of Veggie Burger at Ketchup:
No taste, lacked flavor despite I ordered it with mushrooms and very soggy. 

Taste of Earth Burger at GR Burgr:
Amazeballs!

In other words, pay the extra $2 at Burgr for a burger that tastes far more better than a tasteless, soggy burger at Ketchup.

Went here for lunch shortly after arriving in Las Vegas. We didn't know much about the place but it looked intriguing! They also had a 2-for-1 hotdog deal which made it that much more appealing. The food was average but their "ketchup bar" was the show stealer - we tried every variety! The Balsamic Ketchup was our personal favorite. I just wished they bottled it up so we could take some home :)

I got the mac burger and garlic fries. The burger was dry and flavorless. Fries were OK, but burger was a big disappointment. I did like the different ketchup selections, but would not go back. Way overpriced!

We liked it a lot.  I personally did not get a burger, but my husband did.  Connor and Cole where very nice and considerate.  Went out of their way to help us with an additional request.  The balsamic ketchup was AWESOME!!!

I ordered the western burger and fries and really enjoyed both. Loved the ketchup bar. The milkshakes are on the thin side for the price. The service was friendly and attentive.  I would visit them again.

Tried with a Groupon. Suprised to be allowed to use multiple Groupons in one visit.  However, not allowed to purchase any specials with the Groupons (e.g half price chicken fingers).  Food tasted good, however nothing amazing here.  Really liked the fries.  Burgers were somewhat greasy.  Good location inside Miracle Mile shops.  I probably would not eat here regularly due to higher prices for burger and fries than Im used to (approx. $16 with tax).

Bought a groupon so I thought I would try it out.  When you think premium burger place you think something like Burger Bar.  This is not that kinda place.  Ordered a standard cheese burger with fries.  Burger was way over cooked and was obviously a pre-frozen hockey puck.  The bun was not bread as much as it was styrofoam.  Ate half of it.  Fries were actually quite good.  Cooked crispy and salty and fresh.  The wide selection of ketchup was also a nice touch. With all the other great options out there I see why they offer a groupon to get people to try them out.

The driest burger i ever had. Tasteless. I ordered an egg on the burger and it too was dry. I asked for another egg and it was completely raw and thrown in a dish. The burger was $13. Simply put...they just don't care.

We came here because we saw that the Kings game was playing on their televisions. We ordered our food which was ok. Once the first intermission was over the channel was changed to basketball which obviously bothered us. When my husband went to ask the blonde bartender to change the channel she gave him an attitude and responded very rudely. My sister in law then called the restaurant and requested to speak with a manager which was not available. We were then directed to the same rude blonde. Needless to say they were unable to get the television back to the Kings game. I would not recommend this place. The food is overpriced and the customer service is poor.

Here are just the FACTS about burger joints on the Las Vegas strip from somebody who has been going to Vegas regularly for the last 15 years.
#1 for the price has got to be Bobby Flays burger place. Never been disappointed yet and the price is even cheaper than Johnny Rockets.
Biggest Rip-off: Guy Fieri's place. Wow, is this place expensive.....two burger, two beers, two orders of sweet potato fries $55 after tax and tip. And folks, let me tell you, Guy Fieri is a great guy to watch on t.v. but his burger is nothing special (the fries were very good though, again, $$$$).
Ketchup falls somewhere in between. With a groupon offer this place is absolutely worth it, without a deep discount I'd skip the joint and, again, head over to Bobby Flays.
This is my story and I'm sticking to it......that is until I find something better!

The female bartender ruined this place for us. I wish I had gotten her name so I could personally name her but she was the blonde one. Avoid her if you can. Since they don't give water cups at the counter we were told to go to the bar for water so we did but apparently we bugged her because she completely tolled her eyes and gave us a snotty attitude as if we were bothering her. We were actually going to order drinks but after that no way. We just wanted to get out of there. So rude. Never going back and telling people to avoid her.

Horrible service. Horrible food. Waitress brought us the wrong food, then gave it to the correct customer after we touched it. Deep fried pretzels with cheez whiz. Both nasty! $32 for a basic burger, blta, 1 order each of fries and pretzel bites, and 1 soda. The blta came dry (menu says it has mayo) and the girl was stingy with the mayo when asked for it, which took long enough for the toasted sandwich to be cold and crunchy. Never again! Keep walking, there's a number of fast food places on the strip where you can get cold mediocre food without horrible service and for way less $$$$.
Refills of the panty droppers for $10 are key if you're staying at the Elara!! Poutine is to die forever hangover food. Went there 5 times on a 4 day trip.

Blah from start to finish, except the soda fountain.  The hostess and bartender had no personality. The burger buns were greasy and mushy.  Never asked how we wanted meat cooked.  Fries soggy, onion rings so so.  Ketchup sauces, nothing so special at all. Best part, soda bar, choose coke or diet coke and get perhaps 8 options of each with different flavors. Won't be back. Bobby Flay's Burger Place down the street is so much better.

Not good, had the western burger...dry, over cooked, not juicy at all. Not sure what was premium about this place. Very disappointed, unsatisfying. 2stars for the buffalo blue fries they were fair, but soggy due to to much franks hot sauce.

I work in the mall and I usually come here after I close for a beer. The two times I've came here Cheryl is our bartender. She's definitely upbeat and funny. If you check in on yelp you get a free spiked smoothie shot which was delicious! Besides drinks being good, so is their food. I tried the Wakey Wakey burger and what sold me was the egg ad sweet potatoe fries on it.

I had the Morning Glory. Pretty good and very filling. Try the Parmesan fries! Nice selection of ketchup though some of them were empty. Wanted to try the garlic ketchup. Didn't get a drink but they do have a full liquor bar which is nice.

Found a Groupon they also had a few specials tuesday buy hotdog get one.  Basic burger special was reasonable.  With groupon was able to get specialty burger,  specialty fry and milkshake for about  $20. And with counter service saved tip at other nearby places.  Severing size was good and food was pretty good as well better than chain we ate at previous night down the mall.  

Def come back with coupon or promotion.  Place was clean. . off strip tucked back in planet Hollywood mall (not a huge fan of the craziness of strip).

Counter staff were helpful and pleasant without Vegas show.

Good: 
- Good size burgers and sides (fries, onion rings, etc.) and pretty tasty ;)
- Opens until 2AM!!! (we were surprised to find how few restaurants and eateries actually open past 10 or 11pm in Vegas.)
- Those choose your own flavor sodas machines - you know, the ones with like 17 buttons that you can make your own grape flavored Sprite or something. this one even has diet Barq's! ;)
- Two for One Draft or fountain drink for HaPpy HouR - good for beer, but if you're just getting a fountain drink, just use the "make it a meal" option, which makes your drink essentially free with your fries.

Fair:
- My sweet potato fries were good - for the half that were actually properly cooked. the other half should've stayed in the fryer longer :( The gals there were nice enough that if I asked, they'd probably make a new batch for me. But it was a lot of food, and I didn't really need more.

If it's hard to see the prices on the pictures, here's the gist of it that's not on their website - prices:

- BURGERS are about $9 for a hamburger to $13 fancy schmancy. 
- Sandwiches, Salads, Chicken Tenders $6-7
- Fancy-named hot dogs $6-8

- ADD cheese for $1 (a bit steep, but considering i was adding it to a $9 burger, it wasn't too bad), bacon or chili for $1.50, jalapeno, grilled mushroom, or caramelized onion for $0.75

- Milkshakes $7, SPIKED shakes $9

- Sides: 
    @ fries $3.99 (add fries and soda to meal $4.49
    @ sweet potato fries $4.99 (add it AND soda to meal still $4.99 - no joke. that's how i ordered it. sweet ;) right?)
    @ "panko crusted" onion rings (didn't taste that different from regular onion rings, sorry!) $ 5.99

I didn't come across any prob with service. It was ordered at the counter, put your number on the table, they bring you food, they later clear your food as you finish, but you refill your own fountain drinks - type of thing. We weren't pressured to tip. Got luckier than at least one other reviewer I guess?

My bf and I grabbed some fries" to go" yesterday because we were catching a show and the fries were hot, fresh and a really good shareable portion. Delicious!! Then we stopped there today after a show and ordered fried pickles" to go". Amazing! We ended up eating them there because we didn;t want them to get cold and my bf ate half even after saying he didn't want any. They were hot, fresh, and delicious and great shareable portion but you wont want to share these pickles. YUMMY!!!

Looking for a GREAT burger and beer - this is the place. Super fast food service and beer refills. Kudos to the bartender she really knows how to draw people in and provided my wife and I with excellent service.
Burger was amazing! Bun was perfectly toasted. Spiked milkshake was so good! I got the one with fruit loops & I couldn't taste any alcohol yum

Decided to check this place out because of their "bogo free hotdog Tuesday" sign. 
Upon entering, the bartender greeted, offered us a menu and even took our order. All the while she was making drinks and entertaining her customers. (Great service)
We got our food really quick, it wasn't crazy busy but there was maybe about 8 people. Even though we got the bogo deal and our food was delicious.. I really wouldn't pay $10 for 2 hotdogs ever again.
Right after we were done eating, a worker came and took our trash and asked how the food was.
Overall, I LOVED LOVED LOVED their service! Just a little too pricey for just hotdogs but probably will go there again to try other stuff on their menu.

I had the Classic Burger. It was just OK and plain. This is the type of place where you have to dress the burger yourself because nothing except the veggies come on it. Condiments were on a side wall, which included different types of ketchup--a first for me. I had to ask for mayonnaise and don't know why they don't keep the packs out with the ketchup and mustard packs. I wish they could've seasoned the burger a bit...oh well. The service wasn't bad or great. I don't know if I would go back.

How is it their own website says they close at 2 am and I walk in 1230am they say they are closed.  They gave poor customer service. If you are going to state your open and closing times make sure they are not off by 2 hrs. Its vegas people eat late not early.

Update i went there again.  Burger was ok and fries not a place to crave for unless you have a deal.

We came here for a quick bite, when we were visiting Vegas.  Great atmosphere.  Loved there selection of drinks and different ketchup.

We got the crunch dog, which was by far one of the best hotdogs we've ever eaten.  The fries were a little bit to salty for my liking, but once you dip it with ketchup you didn't notice it so much.
Worst service ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They walk away while your ordering. They were not even busy!!!!!!!!!!! It's not brain surgery.
The moco loco is the shit the fries are bomb and all the different ketchups....... the shit

I probably would not return to this place due to the setup and the price. Two burgers, fries and one drink came to a whopping $36. While the portions were hardy they were by far $35 hardy. It didn't help the bartender admitted they're not supposed to advise how large the sides (fries) are to discourage you from buying less. Over all nothing spectacular just a regular burger.

We liked the drink (chocolate pretzel) but not the service. I was stopped by the moving advertising slides (not sure what its called) Nutella Smoothie outside of the store thats why we stepped in and asked the girl at the register if they had something Nutella Smoothie and she gave me the face and said what? no we dont have it. I clearly saw the word Nutella so we tried to take a picture of it and show it to her, when I came to ask her about it again, she looked up and went back to what she was doing, when she was done she came to me without asking anything. I asked her again if the store had this, at first she said no then she told me to go the bartender to ask for it... okeee... oh and I didnt forget to catch her name, its Gloria.
Good burger place! A bit on the pricey side, which gosh.. Vegas just is, but the customer service was nice, the food was good. I really don't have any complaints!
Burgers weren't that great and the service at the bar is horrible.  Order from take out area and get a number.  Not rushing back.  Bummer...

I chose to build my own burger with a turkey burger, bacon and pepper jack. While the burger was very good and filling, I was annoyed that the turkey patty was $2.75 extra, cheese was $1 and change and bacon was extra  (not surprised about the bacon, though). I was further annoyed because we had a buy one, get one free coupon and my burger was supposed to be free (my husband got the high roller), they only took off 9.25 which would've been the cost of a beef burger without toppings. In the end, its like I paid full  price for 2 burgers. If you have a buy one get one coupon, just get 2 specialty burgers because building your own will not be worth it if they're not taking off the cost of each topping. Pretty dumb in my opinion. Good food, though!

My wife and I each had a Western burger, vanilla shake and a shared order of onion rings.  The burgers were large, juicy, delicious and definitely filling.  They tasted better the more we ate.  The shakes were everything you want in a shake - thick, cold and sweet.  The straws provided were the largest diameter that I've ever used.

The onion rings were a let down.  Too thick for my taste and slightly underdone.

The atmosphere is sports bar which was a great place to watch the NBA Finals.  The 3 star rating comes from the overall low value to dollars ratio - this is an overpriced burger bar.  Excellent food but not worth the price.

I had the chili cheese dog and it was really good. My wife had the corn dog, she really liked it, it was crispy on the outside, and the bread on the inside was still soft without being chewy.  The reason I gave it 4 stars is because you have to buy everything separately.  Yes, you have combo options but I still think everything is overpriced. Plus with all the options you have in the casino you might find a cheaper place to eat. Being there the first time I really enjoy it so if you want a quick bite is not a bad place to stop and eat.

I've decided that to make my observations more full I need to look from both pros and cons 
Pros:
-food is decent and the price isn't too bad
-offers more than just a burger, they also offer chilli cheese fries 
-corner lot and very comfortable atmosphere
-numerous TVs and simple menu

Cons:
I'm huge on service. It's a make or break for me. This is where the the restaurant quickly lost two stars. The person who took my order wasn't very helpful, she didn't even smile, she seemed impatient, and she even said " you should have ordered at the bar, but I'll help you." Being that myself, amongst many only vacationers who probably visit this restaurant ONCE to determine whether it's worth while or not, wouldn't know that so why not just help us and at least pretend you are there to help serve the customer. 
-the bartender was very unaware of her surroundings. She looked at my tag that I needed a beer, said she'll be right with me, helped 2 customers, made only one of my two beers that were already paid for, and helped the next customer. It wasn't until 2 customers later that I said, "sorry I need two...." I shouldn't have to remind someone nor feel like it's up to me to make sure they do their job.... 
-food: the food was decent, they forgot my jalepenos on my chilli fries. The only positive to this was one of the ladies, blonde, who helped me, was extremely friendly and went out of her way to help me. Had it not been for her THIS WOULD HAVE BEEN A TWO STAR RATING.

The first thing I see is Red. From the walls, tables, chairs, trash bins and counter, everything is in the color Red. It's the Ketchup's theme color. The people who work here are quite accommodating. I came here wanting to try a burger and not just any burger on the menu. I want a chicken burger. The good thing is they can make a special custom order. So I chose the Hawaiian Burger with pineapple, chicken, mac n cheese. If I had a name for it, I would call it a "Hula Chick-n-Mac." It's an unusual combination but that's how I like it. When it was prepared on my first visit, it was a juicy, tender chicken breast with a good amount of mac n cheese, and it was delicious! But on my second visit, I ordered the same thing and I was a bit disappointed. There was less mac n cheese, and instead of having the lettuce place on the bottom of my burger bun (like the first visit) they had the lettuce on top, which cause the sauce to soak on the bottom bun and it was messy to eat. I had high hopes for this place but they need to make some improvement on their burger. The consistency and quality of food should always be of utmost priority.

Loved it! Burgers were awesome and fries were delicious! Loved the many different flavors of ketchup, plus the bartender/waiter was awesome! So friendly and attentive, really enjoyed the conversation as well. Just wish I could have tried more food! Everything looked so good. We will be back.

This place has been pretty solid since they opened. The prices are a bit wonky 12.39...7.31 and also a bit high but once you get the food its all worth it. Each part of the burger is phenomenal... The cheese actually taste like cheddar, the bacon is thick cut and the bun is well toasted while the burger is pretty juicy. The fries were well seasoned and crispy and the chili cheese fries option offered enough for two ppl. 

Come on a tuesday and its 2-4-1 hotdogs about $7 total for two and on wednesday they have a burger special for around $5. Also, if you spend $200 in the mall you get a $20 dining credit for the restaurants.
Bar tender took forever to get us a drink, on top of that she was a bit rude. Our food took 30 minutes to get to our table. And it wasn't that good either, I don't recommend it.

Saw the pickle fries on their menu. Stopped for a bite. That and the pretzel bites with cheese . It was good. I must say, I wouldn't pay to actually eat a meal here. The burgers seem really pricey for what it is.

Food was good (classic turkey burger), loved the variety of ketchup. The service was good and the wait was not too bad. I only have 4 stars because this place was expensive. (3 burgers, and 2 fries for $50).. However, it is Vegas and high prices are to be expected, just not for a burger. I would definitely go back if I was in a hurry for a quick meal. Better than waiting an hour and a half for a burger at Gordon Ramsey burgers.

This was sooooo yummy. My boyfriend and I split the western burger and the morning glory , perfect combination! And the fries were HUGE portions. Overall ate way more than I wanted at a reasonable price. The bartender Kim even put on a flare show for us and was super attentive. You should definitely come here if your craving a burger and fries !

Good service.  The burger was cooked to order medium  rare.  The bun was very good but the burger lacked a flavor in the meat.  Also was missing a good crust on the burger.  The bartender/waitress was great and very knowledgeable.  They had 4 different kinds of ketchup you could use with the burger.   Definently worth a visit.

Not very good at all.  I had the breakfast burger and I was not impressed at all.  The burger was dry, flavorless and bland as hell. The burger sounded great on paper, however,  the flavors just did not work.  It was a boring, flat, lifeless burger, with mediocre fires.   I went here on a Groupon worth 20 dollars, but I still had to shell out an extra 18 dollars for only two meals (burger, fries and a drink).  It felt pretty expensive, for such a low quality product. The workers were very friendly, but this is VEGAS, you can throw a rock and hit a better burger place. Try Fuku Burger 10 mins off the strip its a far better choice a super innovative and delicious spot.   I do not recommend this restaurant at all and on my next trip to Vegas it will be skipped with extreme prejudice.

I really have a lot of great things to say about this place. Namely the food was top notch. So our burgers were different and cooked to our different preferences too but they were delicious.
And BIG. I had a mushroom Swiss burger and I couldn't come close to eating it all. The onion rings were huge, crunchy outside, hot and tender inside.
The staff were very friendly and we got our food pretty fast.
Overall I'd recommend Ketchup to burger loving tourists because it IS great food.
The only bad thing I have to say about it is it's just too expensive for us to go to on a regular basis, and its location on the strip isn't very great for us either. We're local so for us it would be a pain to endure the strip just for dinner, but if you're there anyway and want good burgers and fries and have money to burn, definitely go there, you'll love the food.

Nothing too special about this place . 

But, they have poutine. It's located right next to the parking lot entrance inside Planet Hollywood. 

Good place to have lunch if you're looking for casual and quick.

SIDE NOTE: they do have an assortment of ketchup including sriracha!

I feel like this place has potential but is possibly not managed correctly. I dont remember the name of the burger I got but it was a breakfast one with a fried egg, hash brown, and bacon. Both times I've gone here I've gotten this burger. The taste and cook of the burger was delicious however both times we went here the egg was not fried it was fully cooked which kind of ruined the purpose of having a fried egg on your burger. I went here with two friends who did not eat but they ordered shakes instead. We waited thirty five minutes for my burger (not packed inside) and they did not bring the shakes out. We waited fifteen more minutes and finally my friends decided to walk up to the counter to see if they had forgotten about the shakes, even though they said they didn't. I decided to just eat and finish my meal and even after demolishing my burger and fries their shakes STILL were not out yet. Finally after going to the counter again they finally brought out the shakes which were terrible. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THEIR SHAKES. I'm not over exaggerating it was literally like water blended with ice and a dab of chocolate syrup. So overpriced for the super low quality shake you get. We could've just saved money and gone to a fast food restaurant for a better quality. Other than terrible food and service, the place didn't run smoothly. All the employees seemed confused constantly about who ordered what or what came with someone else's order. No one seemed to be communicating with each other. And it was very visible just by observing their Dynamics and interactions with other guests. Overall I will never be returning here but hopefully to another location!

Longer wait then I anticipated (yes I know it's made fresh to order but there were only two people in front of me) but I thought the food was good. Perhaps not what most people would expect to pay ($30 for two burgers and one large fry) but it's Vegas and I needed something fast.

Gf and I ordered burgers, a side of Parmesan Fries to share, and 23oz beers. I got the Mac and Cheese Burger and she got the breakfast style burger with egg and hash browns on it. The Burgers were above average and fries were below average. The beer was in a frosty mug which was nice (especially when you're paying what it costs to drink a beer in Vegas). I gave it 4 stars instead of 3 because the bartender was very nice and attentive. Spent about 45$ plus a tip, about the going rate on the strip for what we got.

Apparently this is supposed to be a Dubai's attack on Vegas. To find out which oasis in the desert is better? Probably not...

Ketchup is a unique mix of a fast food like burger joint and a bar. Casual, on the cheap and accessible. And be warned, their burgers are BIG!

We had Ketchup classic with caramelized onion, and Vegas dog. Not bad, but not great either. Fries were unimpressive. Perfectly fits my definition of 3 stars.

Great staff and service mediocre beef burger, delicious shakes, and good chili cheese fries.
They also have many flavors of ketchup which is cool, I created a chocolate strawberry fruit loop shake which was devine.
Its right at the entrance of the Miracle Mile shops if entering from the parking garage

My husband and I got a Groupon for this place and we ordered the Hot Mess and Morning Glory burger. He said the morning glory tasted great but my Hot Mess was just okay. The avocado was spread onto the bun and the buns were really large so I didn't eat them. I ended up eating beans, burger and some jalapenos.

We have come to Ketchup on numerous occasions while in vegas and we have always enjoyed it.  The burger was super tasty buy the fries were so stale and extremely over powered with their salt seasoning.

The girl server at the bar was rude and didn't give me back my change. It wasn't much but its the principal. The food was not good. Don't go here! Groupon trick me! All the other bad reveiws are true about this place. BEWARE!!!!!!

Stopped here on our way from the parking lot for Planet Hollywood to our room. The restaurant is self serve in that we had to place our order at the bar. The mushroom swiss burger arrived dry and lukewarm. The onion rings were hot and tasty. The best part of the meal was the ice cold Bud Lite which was refreshing after a long day of travelling. For $35 bill of one burger, one order of onion rings, and two Bud Lites, one could do better at In - N - Out.

burger was good but the service sucked. The name of the place is Ketchup and what is the one thing they didn't have Ketchup, asked for Ketchup after the server dropped the food and ran back to talking to another young customer, she was more interested in getting a date then waiting on paying customers. The Bartender didn't even know where they kept the ketchup but found 4 "Packs" of Ketchup not a bottle. The service is like a cheap fast food joint but the prices are like for a steak house, $23.01 for a Swiss and mushroom Burger and tater tot with a draft beer. worth $12 tops. Never once came back to see if everything was OK and the bartender never asked me if I wanted another beer as it was empty for half my meal. Will never return and tell everyone to go else where.

After reading the review it seems as the management does read or care about the service.

Yuck. I ordered a hamburger and garlic Parmesan French fries. My husband ordered a roast beef burger. It was such a disappointment. The burger patties did not taste fresh, and neither of us ate even half of our hamburger, though we were really hungry. The garlic Parmesan fries were just mediocre. We left most of our food behind. There was a party of three sitting at the table next to us. They left without eating their hamburgers.
On the positive side, hence the 1 score given, they have a variety of flavored ketchups.

Grabbed some late night fries with my cousins here this past Saturday evening. They give you a HUGE portion for $4 - easily shareable with 4 people and I like the variety of ketchup/dipping sauces they have for you to try including buffalo sauce, balsamic ketchup, hickory ketchup and fry sauce (tasted like mayo and ketchup mixed). Fast and efficient service!

Why bother with anywhere else. I've been craving a burger for a week now and finally stopped in here on my way out to the parking lot. This is the best burger I've had in ages. I think it was the hot mess (jalapeno, pepper jack, avocado, chili). A little pricey for a burger, and SOOOOOO worth it.  

Plus...wifi that actually works so I can. Sit at the bar.
Surprisingly good Bloody Mary! It has the right amount of spice and they top it with bacon. I still prefer celery to bacon, but it wasn't bad at all for $5!

Giving one star because they need to modify their hours online ... says it closes at 2am everyday but i went at 11:30pm on a thursday and was told kitchen is closed already and that they close at 12am on weekdays. thumbs down for making me walk there for no reason because of your failure to change your hour information online.

I understand that I am in Vegas- but if you are going to charge me $12 for a burger ( no fries) and $7 for a shake- I should at least get table service and a non rude cashier 
Our entire time is Vegas we have encountered nothing but amazing service and staff with tons of personality. This cashier had ZERO personality and was not welcoming 
As far as the burger- I've had better at Red Robin, it was NOTHING special. And for an angus patty - I would've preferred  to have it cooked to my desired temperature , not the medium to medium well it arrived. 
The poutine fries was good- but not great. And the $7 shake ( for vanilla ice cream was nothing special at all The Burger Brasserie at Paris was significantly better all around

The food is terrible. 

I only went here because I had a Groupon for the restaurant. I ordered the Kobe burger. What a huge disappointment. The meat was so incredibly dry and had this odd seasoning to it. Also, ordered a side of fries which were equally as bad. 

All that and the burgers start at $12 without a side! I would never recommend this place to anyone. You can find much better for less money.

This is a really nice place right inside Planet Hollywood, great burgers flavored ketchup and drinks. Our bartender was Sampson, very friendly and very nice. Will come back for sure. Another added benefit is they are ITEX members.

Attention CCSD teachers: Ketchup Burgers is honoring teachers with choice of a free classic burger or hotdog! That extra star in my rating is for giving back to the educators in the community. 

SERVICE: It's a walk-up and order joint with dining available at the bar. I guess the bartender isn't familiar with how to take food orders, because placing my order was much more complicated than it needed to be. He didn't know about the promotion, then didn't know how to ring it up, got frustrated and short with me until a manager came over to help out, then he never said another word to me. I don't know why I tipped him, his bad attitude made me feel guilty for inconveniencing him to serve me.

FOOD: Wanted a mushroom swiss burger, added mushrooms and garlic aioli, and switched out the cheese on the classic, and added a side of fried pickle spears, to make a purchase to offset the freebie.  Received a plain burger with swiss cheese, out three minutes after it was rung up and was room temperature.  Bartender brought it over and didn't even notice the missing ingredients. Went to counter to get assistance, manager stepped in again and had mushrooms brought out to me and comped the pickles. Burger was cooked well done, super dry. The garlic aioli was a smear the size of my thumb. Mushrooms had no flavor. Pickle spears were long and skinny like fries, and served sans any sort of dipping sauce, which I found odd. No flavor other than salty. Didn't finish burger or side. Mad that I wasted the calories on the poor quality I ate. Free or not, I've had better burgers from a drive-thru window.

TL;DR: It's pretty bad to have to complain about something that's already discounted. Staff other than management doesn't seem to care. Appreciated the manager helping out and trying to make things right- but he wouldn't have to comp anything if employees simply did their (very basic) jobs.  Oh, and considering I was seated at the bar, I was never given a beverage or even asked if I wanted one.

Literally just ate here and am so grossed out by it. I had the classic ketchup burger and some fries. Let me start by explaining that I love burgers! And I always find myself in the planet hollywood shops because I love shopping there. So it made sense to eat here during my shopping break.  I got my burger pretty quickly. And when I took a bite I was so dissatisfied.  The bun was super greasy and soggy. The meat was tasteless bland and soft and the tomatoes were smeared with ketchup.  No thanks.  I'll get Chipotle next time!

Really good fries! We ordered the buffalo fries and chili cheese fries, super yummy, We also tried the mac burger which had mac &Cheese and bacon on it, burger was cooked a little to much for my liking but the buns were super good, over all I really liked the fries and their different ketchup flavors!
Buffalo french fries are really good. Fries are crunchy so are the hot dogs. Got chili cheese was really good size & juicy.

Why oh why would one eat here when there are so many other amazing burger and hit dog places around The Strip? Oh yeah, we had a Groupon.

We skipped the burgers and got a chili cheese hot dog (with bacon added), poutine fries, and regular fries (so we could try all the different ketchups). The hot dog was alright. Nothing near as good as say Pink's (which is also located in Planet Hollywood). It was big and thick and loaded with all the toppings. The chili was meh. The poutine fries were edible, but far from even qualifying as good. The regular fries were just frankly icky. The variety of ketchups was great and the maple bacon ketchup and hickory ketchup were standouts.

It's located in the Miracle Mile Shops. If you park in the shops parking garage, this is one of the first places you will see when you enter the shops.

You order at the counter, receive a number, and then take a seat of your choosing.

There's also a small bar area if you want to get an over-priced beer ($7 for a Stella).

The counter staffer was incredibly less than pleasant. She looked like she had just rolled out of bed and would rather be anywhere but there. 

We arrived just before the dinner time rush. And with just one staffer to place and bring out orders, we could see our order sitting in the window for way too long. We finally went and got it ourselves. Not cool.

And then a woman who I presume was a manager came out and started helping deliver the orders by yelling out the numbers instead of finding them. Not disruptive at all.

And the music was definitely way too loud.

And the food is definitely way over-priced for what you get.

So nope, we won't be dining here again.

Have lived in  Vegas  for  2 years.  Been  in  the Miracle  Mile shops before and saw Ketchup.  It looked like a fun place but wasn't craving a burger.  Amazon  Local had a deal for it so I  thought I would take advantage while  my wife and Kids were out of town.  I had $22 to spend so I was sat at the bar (of course).  Cheryl was the bartender and very enthusiastic.  She recommended the burger and beer deal for $10.  Sounded good to me (although I had to add bacon to it).  So I have only spend $10 of $22 at this point so I am doing great.  Added on $3 fries. $13.  I still have $9.  Cocktail I say.  Whiskey Sour please.  Cheryl says that is $10 or $10 with a souvenir cup same quantity of booze.  But I can bring it back and get a drink in it for $5.  Deal.  Ok so I am at $23 bucks not bad.  1/2 way through the experience I show her my Amazon deal.  She says that due to the Burger and Beer Deal I can't get that discounted.  Oh crap I should have mentioned this when I first sat down.  My fault.  Ended up using the $10 to get 2 32oz PBR's.  So I spent a little more than I wanted to but I was definitely "buzzed" after that experience.  The burger was good and the Cheryl was hilarious.  A lot of people had Groupons  and Amazon Local deals (hope they mention it first thing).  I will be back even without a deal

Ketchup is a fast casual burger restaurant located inside of the Planet Hollywood at the Miracle Mile Shops. Do yourself a favor and snag one of the coupon books from the information desk in the middle of the mall, this will save you some $$$.

Service- The cashier was friendly and patient with the 5 of us, as we all had coupons and he had to ring each order up separately. The coupon was for a free order of fries and soda with the purchase of a burger. The food was done really quick which is a good and a bad thing. Good because we were hungry, but bad because if food is coming out that quick it must be sitting on a grill or in a warmer.

Ketchup- Along the side wall there was is a self serve area that includes a ketchup bar with 6 different sauce pumps, 4 of them were ketchup flavors. They had sriracha, balsamic, hickory and regular ketchup as well as buffalo and fry sauces. I thought they were all okay but preferred the fry sauce best. They also have the Freestyle Coke machine.

Food-  I ordered the Mac Attack burger ($12+)  described on the menu as "angus patty, fried macaroni and cheese patty, bacon, cheddar cheese, garlic aioli." They didn't ask how I wanted it cooked and it came out almost well done. This leads me to believe my theory of food sitting on the grill/warmer is correct. Luckily the toppings made the burger edible. I really enjoyed the mac and cheese patty because it was melty and cheesy and added some really good flavor. The garlic aioli was minimal but tasty and worked well with the other toppings. And of course the bacon was good but I would have preferred it to be more crispy. My meal came with a generous amount of fries and they were okay but they weren't hot.  I am sure glad they were free because they are almost $5 for a small side. Yeah I know we are on the strip but that is ridonkulous. My dining complains all had a different burger and while we all agreed they were edible, we were glad we had the coupon and we wouldn't come back.

Had a great experience here with the whole family of six.  A) even though semi-self-serve, the Friday lunch manager was a super helpful young man getting us situated with the kids etc, bringing over everything we needed. B)The ketchup selection (8 or 9) was awesome  C) Food was great

Famous pros and cons bullets! No babbling chatter!

Pros 
Ok burgers if you like them
Convenient location right next to parking entrance
7 kinds of ketchup!

Cons
Expensive for burgers - 10+ bucks and no fries???
Fries separate 5 bucks?
Im easy to please but service was unpleasant at best. Waitress never came by and girl at the register looked angry at life.
Burgers regular size nothing special not worth more than 7 bucks alone. 
Place decorated like cheap cafeteria. 

In sum ok food but not worth the money.

Hamburger dry overcooked and expensive. Employees not working. No receipt. Bartender competing with restaurant to get kitchen orders but even with no customers my wife had to borrow dish towel to clean our table. Bartender said she doesn't clean tables. Manager busy interviewing girls. Not good

I ordered 4 burgers and 2 hot dogs at the Miracle mile in Las Vegas. I asked if any of my orders has pork product the employee said not at all. Than I get my burgers 35 min later and sure enough all has chili. So I asked the employee again dose the chili has lard? She said WHATS THAT? I said pork fat. She said I don't know. I asked her please could you ask? She did and came back telling me yes it dose!!! I told her I'm sorry   I can't have it if I eat anything has lard I will end up in the hospital due to allergy. Employee replied "but you ordered it" I said I'm sorry but I can't eat it. Also reminded her about me asking her before ordering!!! She kept arguing. I asked for the manager it was another female who also gave me a lecture about it's my fault and pretty much I have to suck it up!!! I told her instead of telling me it's my fault you should educate your employees that lard is pork.  I got my money back after the manager throw the food in front of me with attitude. Trying to make me feel bad.  Horrible service and staff. Let's add overpriced.

WOW!!!!! KETCHUP is amazing!! Fry sauce, garlic ketchup, balsamic ketchup, srirachi ketchup, hickory ketchup and much more. Never thought flavored ketchups could be so delicious. Burgers are scrumptious!!! So many varieties of burgers to choose from. And hot dogs too! You can even get a hot dog on your burger! Crazy good milkshakes too!! A definite must have when you come to Vegas.

As a local, I feel this place is a little pricey but that's the Strip for you.. It's to make a dollar off the tourists. BUT, the Veggie Burger was very good. I loved the Sweet Potato fries, and I never thought to try Sriracha ketchup- that was Amazeballs. I wouldn't PLAN to go here... But if I were around the area, I would definitely eat here again.

The Ketchup lover in me walked by this at The Miracle Mile Shops and it caught my eye. I ended up coming in and nobody was at the register and there was a sign to order at the bar. I ended up ordering *Wings*, *Mac Attack Cheeseburger*, and *Parmesan Fries*. While waiting for the food I noticed there was a wide array of Ketchup Flavors to choose from. 

The burger I ordered which included mac and cheese had a juicy patty and tasted bomb! And the wings were hot, fresh, and crisp. As for the fries they were plentiful and I opted to dip the parmesan fries in their "garlic ketchup" which complimented it very well. The bartender gave great service, and I noticed shortly after they opened up the front register with a cashier.

Portion sizes are good, but it's really overpriced for mediocre food. Burger was overcooked. Fries are frozen, poutine was too salty, and onion rings are okay (nothing spectacular). They have a few sauces like sriracha ketchup, hickory ketchup, "fry sauce" (sort of like a chipotle mayo), and regular ketchup to make the meal a bit more enjoyable. It's good if you're hungover, staying in Planet Hollywood, and don't want to walk anywhere else in Vegas.

Hit up Ketchup on a Groupon...2 nights in a row.  Fabulous bar service! Great food! Super fresh burger buns. HUGE portions. Like NONE in our party finished our burgers. They were massive.

They're fry baskets are piled up for like a party of FOUR! And OH! So gooood. They offer super awesome ketchup flavors too. Our favorite was the 'FRY SAUCE' i.e. mayo & ketchup.

Whn in Vegas-burgers beer and nekked zombies! Life is O so gooood!

2017 Review 36/100

Ketchup is always one of my first stops when I arrive in Vegas and this most recent trip was no exception. I can't really speak to the food but the spiked milkshakes are great and are why I go. They have a variety of amazingly delicious spiked milkshakes that will get your Vegas vacation off on a great foot. My personal favorites are the Strawberry Shortcake and the Dirty Pretzel.

Located inside The Miracle Mile, the vibe at Ketchup is very diner-esque. You order at the counter and have your food brought to you. You can also sit at the bar and order, which we generally do so we can order drinks. The staff is great - I've had great service every time I've dined there.

Wow I really enjoyed this place. I got the Mac attack burger with no bacon and fries on the side and I couldn't even get thru half of my burger.  

Now I see what they call this place ketchup. They have a really great ketchup sauce bar that I had a lot of Experimenting with. My boyfriend and I both agreed that the curry ketchup is really where it's at (so hey don't be afraid to try it ! )  

The alcoholic milkshakes should almost be illegal they are so good. We got the tipsy gorilla and honestly it just felt like I was enjoying a dessert. 

Overall, this is going to be one of my new fav places. Worth a try ! We used a group on too!

Conveniently located right by the self parking of miracle mile. Enticing menu of unique spiked milkshakes.  I grabbed a quick Angry Orchard. I noticed the different flavored ketchup... Siracha, balsamic.... Hence the name!  Very cool. 

JENNIFER was bar-tending and she is AWESOME!  She put up with the drunk goofballs pretty well.  Very nice and she made us some delicious fruit loop shots!  Loopy Three Olives Vodka and ice cream. Wow! I've got to come back for the fireball milkshake.

The burgers weren't actually that bad, but I swear it wasn't even that busy and the food took forever to come out. 

Had to wave down the staff to get our refills, stopped waving them down the second time and just asked for the check and left immediately after.

Pretty decent place to grab a burger and  convenient to the shops at the miracle mile and the V theater. Ketchup bar was cool, try the balsamic and sriracha.  The Hun was a bit more than I wanted so I picked it in half but all around cooked to order a yummy burger. Try the blue burger and their grown up milkshakes!

Okay so this place is a pretty cool spot. I gave it 3 stars for many reasons. 

1. The food is really not worth the price. I mean i get that its vegas and things Are just pricier in general but i mean $20 for a burger n fries n drink is pretty steep
 
2. Its sort of a fast food joint so paying $40 for a couple i felt like i paid restaurant prices at a in n out. 

3. They charge for everything!!!! I spent $40 got 5 different things then asked for ranch and they said its $.50... Are u kidding me!!?? 

4. The cashier didnt really care about what he was doing.. Didnt help us with anything.. He had our food sitting under the hear lamps for so long i went up and asked to get them... My chili cheese fries were so cold i asked them to mKe new ones. So i put a little onion on top to mark it to see if it'll be there when they brought it back and sure enough it was there!!! 


There is nothing special about this place.. If you dont have a deal or a group on DO NOT PAY FULL PRiCE!!!

Groupons and Burgers are two things I love--- thus I ended up here.

I got an uber unimaginative and very bland Turkey Burger. It tasted like a flavorless frozen patty. With all the toppings and extras I added to it,  this ended up being one Sad-Ass $14.00 Burger. (Half Star rating -- avoid until Turkey Burger patty recipe is revisited). 

My fiance said her Hawaiian Burger (with Chicken substitution) was mediocre. Not the greatest and not the worst, but nothing to remember or return for. 

Ketchup has a premium location and great for people watching along the miracle mile. The onion rings and alcohol-milkshakes both looked intriguing and might tempt me next time I pass by.

Good good and good service at a good price, have have you guys ever cleaned the TV's, or any of the other fixtures?! It scares me to think what might be falling into good and drinks. I don't think I'll be going back.
Walked in..looked filthy...walked out.  Didn't eat anything because I didn't want to even sit on the seats.  You can do better.

BAD SERVICE. 
I was standing in the mall walkway which is close to their bar trying to decide if my family and I should eat there (total of 10 adults and 3 kids (picky eaters)). While I was waiting for my Uncle to come back from the parking garage I was watching their tv screens they had at the bar when this lady with red hair asked me if I wanted to order anything to drink or eat, I told her no, not right now because I am just waiting. She said "I am going to have to ask you to sit on the bench" she said I couldn't watch their TVs if I wasn't going to order. (The bench was in the middle of the walkway). As soon as my Uncle came back, we took our business elsewhere. 
There are so many other restaurants,  why waste time and money on one with rude staff.

Taste-wise, the burgers at Ketchup are great as far as fast food burgers go. The only problem is that it's almost the same price as a some of the gourmet burger spots around town. 

I ordered the Big Bleu Burger ($12) and my girlfriend ordered the Morning Glory ($12). Both burgers were satisfying. The meat quality was above most fast food chains, and the ingredients tasted fresh. Aptly, Ketchup has a variety of different ketchups that you can choose from. I'd highly recommend the balsamic ketchup or the hickory ketchup.

But Ketchup burgers are far from gourmet--although they want to be so badly. Don't get me wrong, the food tastes great, but it's not worth $12 a burger (and that's without fries or a drink). We had a Groupon, so we thought we'd try it out. But honestly, I'd rather pay an extra $2 per person and get a true gourmet burger at Gordon Ramsay's BurGR, which is literally in the same building.

I could have easily given this place 2 stars, but as a standalone burger joint, I couldn't complain about any of the food. 

This place is great if you want to spend the same amount on a fast food burger as you do on a gourmet burger. But honestly, Carl's Jr. has the same type of burgers for half the price. I get that it's Las Vegas, and this place also has a full bar attached to it, but part of eating on a budget is being wise when choosing a place to eat. Heck, even if you're not on a budget, it just makes sense to go to a better burger spot for the same price. Ketchup Premium Burger Bar is not a wise decision in either situation. It's great if you have a Groupon, but otherwise, just go to BurGR down the hall.
Nothing special. Overpriced hot dogs and hamburgers. I ended up paying 15 bucks for two hot dog combo meals and I had a 20 dollar Groupon.

Decided to purchase a Groupon like any smart soul would do if you wanted to try the food here.  Everything is extremely overpriced and it's only a matter of time before peeps figure it out and avoid this fast food vixen. 

Ordered a hot dog and a mushroom cheeseburger.  The hot dog arrived on a toasty bun with standard fixings including sauerkraut, onions, ketchup and relish. The hot dog was decent but as I was eating it, I thought of Costco and how I could get the same thing there which includes a coke. Here the regular price for a coke and the dog is $10.00 plus tax.  

When the burger arrived it wasn't the right one and we had to send it back. The waitress was pleasant and got the right one out very quickly after the mistake.  

The burger was very juicy and was actually quite good.  The burger had mushrooms and cheese on a lightly toasted bun. 

Will I be back?  Probably not.  But we thought we would give this place a shot despite all the bad reviews.

My friends and I stayed at the Elara. It was right next to Planet Hollywood and we decided to come out for dinner. The location had plenty of seating and it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the Big Bleu burger and the Poutine fries. The Poutine fries had gravy and cheese. It was enjoyable, but the fries could have been better. I feel like their unique sauces like the Sriracha ketchup helped to liven things up. Otherwise, the fries themselves were mediocre. The burger itself had a tasty bun and it was cooked to medium well. It was a bit overcooked in my opinion. And I usually enjoy medium rare, but it was still a good bite if you're hung over in Vegas and looking for somewhere you don't have to wait.

Not worth the money . I did like that there was a variety of ketchups to choose from but the burgers tasted & looked like the frozen patties you get in bulk at the grocery store. Was not worth my cheat meal for the week. Fries were so/so, nothing special. Would not waste any more $ to come here again. 5 Guys is SO much better!

Amber was awsome.  I've never wrote a review about any place but I felt like I had to on this.  Hands down the best customer service I've received ever.  She remembered me from a previous night and remembered my likes and dislikes.  Great converstion,etc..and honestly came across genuine which is lost in the world today..better customer service then we received earlier in the day at guy fieri's.  I will definitly be back

Ordering the food was a challenge. Gal/cashier should be in the kichen instead of greeting and taking your order. My boyfriend finished half of his food before I received mine. He said his chilli cheese fries were good (I could tell by the lonely 2 fries left on his plate ) and his Western Burger he's trying so hard to finish. My Hawaiian Burger and strawberry shake? Good, but probably would've enjoyed it more my simple order came with his instead of us watching each other eat.
Hubby got the morning glory burger and he liked it. I got the earth burger with a Lettuce wrap since the bun is not vegan. It was really good

Oooooohkay this was the spot to be for something decently priced, packed with flavor, and just enough options. First off they have spiked milkshakes! They weren't super strong but they did taste really good. I got the dreamsicle and it reminded me of childhood (but without the alcohol ha!)

The service was ok, but they were a bit slow even when not very busy. Luckily the food made up for it. They had tons of flavors of ketchup, which was fun to try. 

The High Roller burger I got was so tasty and jeez it was huge! The bacon cheese fries just hit the spot but I suggest getting them to share! 

I say hit this place up for a good bite to eat.

No thanks. We were only here because bf bought a Groupon. But what's the point for coming to Planet Hollywood Resort for a burger joint like this when there's Gordon Ramsay's "Burger" just a few steps down the way on the casino level?

Ordered the Hot Mess burger. It came with chili, jalapenos, cheese and some kind of avocado spread. I specifically asked for it to be well done. Ordered a side of parmesan garlic fries to share. Boyfriend ordered a crispy chicken wrap. The burger meat ended up to be pink. That's definitely not well done. How is well done still pink?! Strike 1.
Brought it back but when it was brought back to the table the second time around, my parmesan garlic fries were replaced with regular fries. Ugh. Strike 2.
The quality of food does not justify the prices here. Strike 3. For a few bucks more, I could head over to a gourmet burger restaurant and receive better quality food.

The pink meat when I specifically asked for WELL DONE was enough for me to knock off two stars. Biting into that was enough to make me lose my appetite. NEVER coming back.

Food is decent; Tuesdays are buy one hot dog get one half off, but the service tanked their review. The teeny bopper employees are clueless. The girl who rang us up didn't bother to give us a number and left me and my husband at the register while she went to help another customer with their food. When we asked, she said she would remember our order - only it was another girl bringing the food.  When I went to get ketchup a huge splash of gross yellow green tinged water splashed on my foot. I told an employee immediately and not only did she not get napkins so I could clean off the gross, she didn't even bother to mop up the puddle of water!
Not good service and the burgers were very dry. Ask ordered a combo and the fries never came :/ Very disappointing!!
Food was excellent! But service was terrible, girl at the counter was rude and looked as though she hated her life with every customer and was not helpful at all.

I really don't understand the negative reviews on here. Yes, the pricing is a little more than your typical fast food place, but the food is much better. This place has happy hour deals and other daily specials that can bring the total price down quite a bit. I've had many different items here and never been disappointed. We always make a stop here while in Vegas!

they have different ketchups to dip fries with however our fries were over cooked. 

wakey wakey burger was good as it was kinda like breakfast in burger form. 3.5/5

sloppy mess was meh as it wasn't anything special. 2.5/5

I would not go out of may to come here but if you are starving and in need of a quick bite with out paying an arm and a leg this may be an option of you.

Went here for Happy Hour yesterday, which they have buy 1 beer or wells drink and get another free. You can't go wrong with that right..??? On to the food.

I ordered chili cheese fries which tasted just like chili cheese fries and I also ordered the Angus burger. The angus burger didn't really do me justice. It was over cooked and there was just too much going on with the sauces and other toppings. Eventually like most burgers it fell apart and you have to use your fork and knife to finish this bad boy. 

Overall I wouldn't come here again unless it's for happy hour but if you're doing some shopping in miracle mile mall and you're starving like marvin for a burger then try it out..

The atmosphere was great and had a juicy Kobe Beef burger. 

As far as drinks, my friend was served the "Cassie" and I'm told it was excellent!

We tried the Mac burger, the blue cheese burger, the fries and the onion rings. The burgers were a good size and tasty. Everything was well seasoned. My least favorite were the onion rings, the onions were to thick and they used the outer ring of the onion, they also didn't give that many. The fries were good and a decent amount. The flavored ketchup are an acquired taste, but ok. I tried them all some I liked more than others, but you have to try for yourself.

Five stars for the Buffalo Fries! I added bacon to mine and took off the blue cheese but, DAMN was this a good pile of potatoes and sauce. It was evenly spread out over the fries so everything was covered at least half. The bacon wasn't hard, but the perfect amount of crunch and softness. Our cashier was super nice when we asked for extra ranch and getting a to go box. I wish I could have gotten his name!
Recommend for out of staters.

Was lucky enough to find a groupon  cute place, great for a quick bite before hitting the strip. I had the western burger, it was huge! My friend had the BlT also huge. The onion rings are a must so good! The also have a specialty ketchup like sriracha!

I was beyond disappointed in this joint. I got a Groupon, and before you even think it, I have got a lot of Groupon's, for good and decent restaurants. BUT this was one of those you're like why did i do this to myself. I figured a head of time I'm gonna be staying at Planet Hollywood, why not try this place out for lunch or dinner? 

Well my Boyfriend and I came and ordered our food it was probably around 6- 6:30 pm, and I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and he ordered some kind of Teryaki Hawaiian Burger, we split a fry and he got a drink. 

It didn't take long to come to our table. But in the mean time he got his drink after them being out of Cherry Coke, and Vanilla Coke flavors, and was TRYING to get some of their different kinds of ketchup they are supposed to be known for our at least is the their whole marketing idea, but oh no they were practically all empty. The maple bacon one, the hickory, and so on. So at this place that is supposed to have some good Ketchup to go with your sandwiches and fries, we had to get plain, old regular ketchup, what a shame right?

So our food came and my buffalo chicken sandwich was not a chicken patty, it was two chicken fingers on a bun, and COVERED, and I mean buffalo  OVERLOAD of sauce, so disgusting it made me not want to eat it as soon as he put it in front of me. It had sauce all over the bottom bun live covered, about to be a BIG soggy,nasty,mess. I' m like it dude, if it taste gross I'm going to need another bun, and the employee looked at me like I'm crazy and he didn't understand why? And they weren't busy, at all. 

My boyfriend's were also covered in that Teriyaki sauce, way too much, don't do that lazy cooks, not cool. If I would've known that I would've asked for no sauce or sauce on the side.

Overall, on vacation you just wanna have good food and good time, and this was a bad time and bad mediocre food that tasted like it was from a bowling alley.

I wasn't expecting much from this place but the burgers were surprisingly decent. There was also a good family value deal that was able to feed 4-5 members of our family.

The interesting here was the variety of sauces at the counter. It's not just ketchup. They have things like sriracha ketchup, garlic ketchup etc.

The fries were crispy. The default burger was small but it was good. I would eat it again.
Walked in and looked over the menu. Waited at register for 10 minutes with no line and never got to order since the cashier said hi and walked away when we walked in and didn't return.

I've only eaten here once, and that was back in 2015. I was in the mood for a burger near my timeshare and i knew these was the place to go.  There were 2 guests ahead of me in line, but i noticed no one was taking their order.  After 8-10 mins, the guests in the front flagged down an employee only to be told with poor customer service to have the bar take the food orders. 

After being redirected to the bar, the bartender then said the place was backed up and we had to wait at least 30 mins for our food. There were people at the bar drinking, but only some tables were occupied for dining. 

Overall, it sucks that the employees were not giving their best efforts customer service wise because they were losing customers, and they had less work ahead of them.

It was good. After walking through the miracle mile shops looking for something to eat. This was the spot we decided on. They were on groupon $11 for $20. We got the super cheeseburger and regular fries. The super cheeseburger is big enough to split. They have different flavors of Ketchup which was kind of cool (sriracha ketchup, maple bacon ketchup, curry, etc). They also have buy one get one free hot dogs on Tuesdays.  Yeah I would eat here again.

This is not a place I chose to go to because I heard the food was great. I went to this place to grab some food before attending the Soundgarden/NIN concert. It was a convenient place to go to for food and it also has a bar. I went on a Saturday and most the people there were also there for the concert. I ordered the Morning Glory burger with sweet potato fries. I think I got lucky with my burger because it was so delicious. It was everything I love about breakfast (my favorite meal) served on top of a juicy burger. The sweet potato fries were pretty badly overcooked so I did not enjoy those. The food is extremely pricy for burgers, but not uncommon for food prices on the strip. Service is pretty slow and it is somewhat like In N Out where you order, then wait for them to call your number and you grab your food. I would have given only 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't give the option.
Kimberly is amazing, full of energy and this the spot to get your Vegas burger! I am so excited about this atmosphere!!!
OMG...This place is  awesome!  Don't miss out on this hidden gem. Hot comfort food and could beer.

F.A.S.T. Review:

Food: I really wanted to try one of their burgers, especially one with an egg, but by the time we dropped by I was too full from a previous meal and just wanted to try the poutine. I was super excited because I don't know many places that serve poutine (although now it's becoming a popular dish). When we finally received our order (see SERVICE) I was sadly disappointed. The gravy was lukewarm and didn't have much flavor to it. There was also barely any cheese curds so the whole dish was pretty bland to me. I had to dip the fries in ketchup which really defeats the purpose of poutine. 

Ambiance: Cute concept, down to the Heinz ketchup garbage cans. Diner like restaurant where you order at the counter before sitting down. 

Service: We were greeted right away and we ordered before a huge line formed behind us. After ordering we killed time by stocking up on the different ketchups and I even looked through the options at the soda machine. 45 minutes later I was wondering what happened to our order. We ordered one item and although the kitchen was pretty backed up, it wasn't like they were cooking a burger or anything. Frustrated, we went back to the counter after we noticed that everyone else had already received their order. Apparently, they had lost our ticket. Big no no. 

Tips: Overall it seemed just like your average burger place on the strip. Nothing really memorable except for the different types of ketchup.

This place was amazing. My best friend and I were in Vegas and wanted a burger. This place was recommended to us and didn't fail. My burger was cooked to perfection and when I say enormous, I had to save some for later. Topped off with the drink I got, the Hazelnutty, a combination of chocolate hazelnut and alcohol heaven, this place gets all thumbs up. Plus the lady that took my order was cool as hell! I cannot wait to go back. Do you have one in NY or any place else!

This was our first time here. We specifically came for the poutine. Now I've never had "the real stuff," so maybe I don't know but it was AWESOME! Me and my family tried it and we all loved it. The gravy was flavorful, the fries were cooked right and the cheese was really good. The bartender welcomed us in and she was very nice. Sorry I didn't get your name! I'm usually good about that. I ordered a michelada. Yum! So good with 2 olives, mmm! We got the crunch dog meal and that was was good also. Just the poutine would bring me back but the staff was great too. Thanks!

My husband and I came and split a burger. It was so delicious I had to get my own. The meet was juicy, the bun was soft, it was amazing! Wish their was one in Los Angeles. Definitely coming back here when I come back to Las Vegas

So I work in miracle mile and have had this place before but not too memorable. Today before work I decided to stop for a burger.

I sat for 4 minutes before the bartender acknowledged me. Then he came over and dropped a menu and then proceeded to help other people. He got their drinks and order in before he even gave me the time of day and I was there first. 

Told the bartender I was allergic to tomatoes and he proceeded to give me a cup to go get my own ketchup.................let that sink in

I saw him pouring the company liquor into his own drink cup. Yes guests can see and notice these things.

Girl who dropped the food said "here you go" and walked away. Didn't smile or ask if I needed anything else.

Reason I gave it two stars was the burger. The mac and cheese burger was pretty good. Nothing amazing but solid burger. So the kitchen at least did something good.

So I'm not the only one who received slow service here? Oh. Well I came here w/my fiancee on Sunday afternoon and it took almost 15 minutes to get 2 burgers and a large fry. It wasnt that busy either. Plenty of empty tables. But back to the burgers!

I ordered a Hot Mess which was a cheeseburger topped with a bunch of chili, jalapenos, and guacamole. It was a hot mess too! I needed a bunch of napkins lol The first bite was so full of flavor. All the ingredients come together nice in that 1st bite. But as the burger cooled down, I noticed the chili wasn't special. It was like regular ol' canned chili. Once my burger got too cool, I didnt even want the rest. It turned from a Hot Mess to a mess. But I blame my woman and I having a good time partly. I didn't just scarf down my mess of a burger.

My woman ordered a Western burger which is just a cheesburger w/an onion ring, 2 pieces of bacon, and hickory ketchup. And she liked almost every bite of her burger, but I ate the rest of her burger once my burger stopped satisfying my tastebuds! We both wondered why there were only two pieces of bacon on a $12 burger... But the Western was an awesome choice.

The KETCHUP was so good. I loved the flare to the chipotle ketchup. I'd go back there just to order a beer at the bar with a fry and that hickory ketchup. That hickory ketchup is the best ketchup I've ever had in my life! Is "the best ketchup ever" a thing? 

The best thing about Ketchup is the ketchup, literally.

My girl was super hungry and unfortunately had a horrible experience. She ordered a chicken classic grilled but instead received a meat patty about 15 minutes later. She went to correct the problem by reordering and thy charged her the difference. She then received a crispy chicken which was not what she ordered. They messed up her order twice and made her wait the longest. Don't think I will be coming here again.

Good, solid choice for a burger joint. Located conveniently right off the parking garage entrance to the Miracle Mile shops. Ambiance is not great, so this is not the spot to come if you are looking for atmosphere.
Both my daughter and husband are obsessed with ketchup and this place, with at least 6 different varieties of it, doesn't disappoint.
My favs were the fry sauce and the garlic ketchup.
Their parmesan garlic fries were very tasty.
I had the Western burger, which is similar to the one you can get at Carl's Jr, but with a better brioche bun and higher quality meat.
Daughter had the corn dog, which was good but pretty standard.
Can't remember which burger husband got, but remember he was pleased with the quality.
Prices are standard for Vegas ($12 burgers $6 fries).
They had shakes and boozy alcoholic shakes but we avoided those (too much sugar!)
This restaurant is close to the Saxe theater so if you are seeing a show there and want close, family friendly and affordable, try it out!

While walking the miracle mile looking for a place to eat late at night we came across Ketchup Premium Burgers. I must say that the staff and the food was absolutely amazing. Brianna and Amanda kicked ass and were awesome keeping the place clean and keeping the customers happy when it got busy. They worked their butts off and the service was top notch. The quality of the food was excellent and I will be returning to this place next time I am in Vegas.

Geez where to start. I really have nothing good to say about this place. I failed to read the reviews before stepping in, my fail, lesson learned! Read the Yelp reviews people!

So this place has a Heinz them with branded trash cans, logos and other borrowed details but it seems they use the name but not the product, bate and switch seems to be a consistent theme, read on...

I order a $17 double bacon cheese burger, the double priced premium hand battered Zuccinni and a soft drink.

Lets start with the staff; no hello, no smile, no thank you for your order. Instead of service I get a flat toned, mumbling and annoyed stiff that seemed put out that she had to talk to me and who offered nothing in the way of help or friendliness. 

Dismayed, I take my number and turn the corner to see a row of flavored ketchups, including Fry sauce which I had to try as everyone in my family likes it. I also grabbed a sample of balsamic ketchup, it tasted like dark colored ketchup nothing special. Fry sauce was bland but tasted sort of what I expected. 

Next up soft drinks: mostly standard, the only diet choice was diet coke, this is a Las Vegas problem as Coke seems to have the town under it's thumb and only diet coke is offered in many places. I always find that odd for a place that prides itself on broad choices and variety. I visit many small, backwood, nowhere towns that have far more variety in soda choices but this is really not Ketchup's fault I guess just a Vegas thing.

I did not try the bar, but since it only had one patron the whole time I was there it did not make me think it was anything to get excited about. 

My food came out after a few minutes and the burger looked good and it was large (see picture) but the pluses stop there. The burger was bland and tasteless, worse they did not even get it right. I was specific about what I wanted on it (or did not want) and they seemed to reverse it. Maybe the annoyed and disinterested order taker could not be bothered to get it right or maybe today was opposite day. The meat was hard, over worked and over cooked with no taste. It was like the taste of fatty grocery store beef it you browned it and tasted it before seasoning. It was just cheap over worked meat not even grilled for broiled. There was a lot of it but so what more does not equal better. Bacon had a decent smoky flavor but undercooked, wet, and fatty. I could not finish it, not because it was too big but because it simply gaged me, it was terrible. I would have been happier with Sonic, Burger King or the local gas station heat lamp burger.

Now onto the premium, hand-breaded zucchini. Staying consistent these were ridiculously bad. Think generic grocery store, frozen, fried zucchini. Tasteless, heavy, poorly battered, clearly machine processed and not fresh at all. They should be embarrassed to call these premium. I did not eat much of them either before feeling sick and regretting my meal. I left feeling bloated and a little sick to my stomach.

So there you have it, stolen branding or bait and switch on the Heinz theme, terrible ingredients on the burger and poorly prepared, and frozen, cheapo, generic grocery store fried zuccini. What a terrible deal but at least they charged me $27 plus tax! 

I'll never be back, if you come upon this place, divert your eyes, keep walking, make the kids look away and run for the nearest exits. Save your wallet save your stomach. And hey Heinz if your really sponsoring this place you need to shut it down and protect your good name.

A solid 3-Stars.

Even if you're really craving a burger and don't have the patience to stand in line for an hour at Gordon Ramsay's BurGR, which is also located in PH, I wouldn't suggest this be an alternative dining spot.

Mushroom Swiss Burger: I ordered this with no mayo and I thought it was fine. The one thing I didn't like about this was how large the buns were and how significantly small the patty was. 

There's an assortment of ketchup, like garlic and Sriracha. The garlic ketchup looked and tasted watered down, and the Sriracha ketchup was just...well, Sriracha and ketchup mixed together.

Can't complain much about the service.The food is made-to-order, and burgers come out within 10 minutes and delivered right to your table. 

Highlight of my visit: The touchscreen soda machine.

I wanted to give this place 5 stars because I was really impressed with the food here but the food came out so slowly! Despite that; I had a pretty good experience here. There was great service and great food!

On Tuesday's, they have a special where you can buy 1 or dog, get the other one for free. Tall boys are sold for $5 (25 ounces)

Surfing Groupon I found a deal for $10 for $20. I live in Vegas, have seen this hamburger place but have never tried it so my husband and I decided to give it a shot. The place is very nice and clean, more of a "fast food" type restaurant than sit down and and be waited on restaurant. There aren't any prices on their website so I was a bit surprised when I got there and it was $11.99 for a hamburger and an extra $4.99 for fries and a drink. Seems pretty standard for a burger place on the strip BUT most are worth the money.

The guy who took our order was very nice, gave us smaller menus to look at. Took our order and we paid. Had no problems using the Groupon. Now the Groupon said something to the extent of don't forget to tip at the FULL price, not the discounted price so we ended up paying $23 for 2 burgers, 2 fries and 2 drinks.

The thing that really annoyed me was they asked for a tip and then right after told us where the SELF SERVING STATION was. So I just gave someone a generous tip to basically take our order and bring it to us. We got our own drinks, own condiments, found our own seat, etc. I like to tip generously for SERVICE and this wasn't a service. I felt that was a little arrogant.

Onto the food. Meh is all I have to say. The fries were awesome, hot and crunchy. The burger was meh. Flavorless, dry and nothing special. I had the western burger which had very little sauce and my husband had the hot mess which he said was also flavorless and dry.

All and all, I probably wouldn't go back unless there was another Groupon and someone in town visiting really wanted to try it.
