The music was also VERY loud and it was hard to carry on a conversation with my husband.

Over-priced. Burger had little flavor. Fries were soso.
Service was very friendly and nice.

Horribly overpriced for a less than average burger. This restaurant gives the appearance of a somewhat custom burger joint but just is an overpriced fast food restaurant. If you value taste, don't spend your money here.

If you think this place is good you must set your standard on McDonalds or be drunk while writing your review. 

The only redeeming quality is that the ladies working the register were nice.

Obviously people come to Las Vegas to drink and Happy Hour opportunities are a bonus... walked past Ketchup twice and saw numerous signs that displayed Happy Hour 3-6pm Monday thru Friday. WELL when we approached the bar and requested Happy Hour beer, the bartender said they do not do Happy Hour on Fridays. I mentioned the numerous signs stating differently, he signed new signs were being printed. I believe a company/business/restaurant should always honor what they market UNTIL a new marketing sign becomes available. We did not stay for beverage service and went to La Salsa Cantina that honored Happy Hour cheaper AND for another hour longer :)

The food was greasy, unseasoned, small portions and the soda machine was broken.  Gave them two stars because the bartender/waiter was nice and the breakfast bowl was on a special for $2.99.  Overall I would definitely not recommend this place even for the relatively cheap price.

My husband and I ate here for our last meal before leaving Vegas. It was a disappointment. The food was not good. We ordered a messy burger and the western burger along with sweet potato fries. My burger was too bland while his had too much sauce. The fries were not that tasty either.

Ok so we ordered chicken strips ,regular fries ,poutine fries and a classic burger with grilled mushrooms & pepper jack cheese. Everything tasted like they dumped a pound of salt on everything.  Only thing was missing was serving saltwater with the meal! Service was good bartender took of the poutine fries.

Best burger I've had! Love the morning glory and the western burger!

Can't get enough, Ate it 3 times while visiting Vegas

An alright place.  They literally made me review it 4 stars or above to get a discount while they watched, so I'm updating this to two stars because that's pretty much a no no, but a decent place for the food I suppose.

Best food ever, whether you're drunk walking on the strip or soberly people watching. First time we went here (we were sober and used their Groupon deal) I got the crunch dog and my fiancée got a morning glory. It was so good and not really greasy at all. We knew we wanted to come here again sometime during our trip so we purchased another Groupon ticket. Except that next visit, we were hammered and completely forgot to use the Groupon. Haha but the food was still as good if not even better (Bc everything taste better when you're highly intoxicated).

Not surprising, many of the reviews note the poor customer service.  We had a small group just stopping in to order and pick up dinner.  The cashier was a rude miserable cow who got mad at us for not mentioning that the orders were for carry out.  She didn't ask but I told her immediately after paying for mine.  I was first but still she didn't ask the other 3 people in my party when they placed their orders and assumed they were dine in (sigh). Stay in school.  When asked where we could find utensils, the same rude cashier pointed to a random spot across the dining hall and said "over there".  We had already looked here, there and everywhere but walked over ...there... and found no utensils.  I asked her again and replied that those were condiments. If I wanted utensils she had to pull them from under her counter or pull them out of her you-know-what perhaps.  It gets worse. We now had all of our food orders after 20 minutes but no shake. The milkshake I ordered... after reminding Ms Personality 3 times, was still no where to be found.  I really wanted my money back. After all, I paid $30 for a burger, small soda, tater tots and a milkshake.  My sis asked the bartender to make it and he tried to charge me for it again. That was another 20 minutes for the shake- I guess he had to milk the cow. The food was good except every one of us had a mistake in the order. We will never go to this place again. It blows and made a bad experience for all of us.

Yuuuuuummmmm
Couldnt br betttter . The best burger ive ever had. Thank you lord we found a good good place in vegas.
Great food. Great service. Good location.
Very pleased with this experience. The biggest 5 star review. I wish they had a location in california.

I ordered a grilled cheese and dipped it in fry sauce. Heaven. They have about a dozen different versions of ketchup and sauce. So good! Vegas Peach was the best drink I had all trip! I wish we had a Ketchup in Cali.

One of the best burgers I've had in Vegas. I keep reading that everything is overpriced and yes that's true, but look where you are. Any couple that goes out in this town and DOESN'T split a meal is out of their mind. The portions in any restaurant in this town are so huge, two people can eat one meal. That being said, my husband and I were here this past Friday night and LOVED this place. They have a special for 11.99 where you get a beer and classic Ketchup burger. This worked out great for us because I wasn't up for beer, my husband wanted beer and we split the burger and an order of sweet potato fries. Yes, $5.09 might seem expensive for an order of fries, but the order was so big the two of us couldn't eat the whole thing. Try these little bits of heaven with the maple bacon ketchup AND kudos to the super sweet waitress who gave us a side of vanilla ice cream to go with the fries. . .OMG! All in all, we got out of their for around $20.00, which is pretty great considering their prices and we had beer. The burger was fantastic, by the way. Again, if you go to most restaurants in this town on the strip or in a prime location, you're going to pay a premium. But if you do it right, you can get out of any restaurant reasonably.

We got a burger and two orders of chicken strips. The strips are buy one get one free on Wednesdays which was kinda cool. Food was very average no greater than McDonald's, but we paid $35.. for a burger, fries, chicken strips and two drinks (for $3.00 each) Although it was clean and associates were friendly, I wouldn't recommend this place. Save your money and get yourself something less average.

The place is in the Miracle Mile Shops on the Strip. The theme is - you guessed it- ketchup. The T-shirts the staff wears all have a logo that's a parody of the Heinz keystone logo. You'd think they'd make that clear on the Groupon I used, or their Website, but they didn't, and the street address doesn't really cut it. I found the place after calling them and wandering around the Miracle Mile shopping center, using the directories to home in on it.

The place is not cheap, but they offer a variety of burgers with clever names, including the Big Blue, with bleu cheese, that I had, onion rings, fries of different varieties including Buffalo fries (fries with Buffalo wing sauce - aka Frank's Red Hot sauce), and the Philly cheese fries, which came with cheese and thinly-sliced steak, onions, and peppers. I got the Philly fries. You can also get shakes, but I thought that would be overkill with the already heart-attack-risking meal I was eating there.  

The soda fountain is "do it yourself," and they have pumps for ketchup, Buffalo wing sauce, and other sauces (BBQ, probably - I didn't look that closely). It's a little confusing, since the counter setup makes it look like customers shouldn't go there, and you should wait for an employee, but it quickly became clear to me that I was supposed to get my own drink (and I later saw a "self service" sign, and the employees all saw me getting my own drinks, etc.)..

I had a Groupon for $20 worth of food for $11 or $12, so the huge meal set me back about $7, including a $2-and-whatever-change tip, or $18 or $19, if you count the cost of the Groupon. The place would be a reasonably fair deal without the Groupon, but it's definitely better to look for a Groupon or other deal (Entertainment book, maybe?) before eating here.

The staff was friendly, and oh yeah, you can get "dirty" or "wicked" or whatever- they-called-them shakes with alcohol in them, and there's a full bar (No, that's not self-serve).  The alcoholic shakes all had clever names - the "Dirty Sanchez" on the menu stood out, since I was a little grossed out at the idea of something called that being in my mouth, not to mention the reference to a stupid young teenage boy myth/joke. But hey - it's Vegas - it's supposed to be "edgy."

Stopped here on a Saturday night right before one of the events at Planet Hollywood. We were pressed for time so we needed something fairly quick. We ended up sitting at the bar and the turn time was pretty good. I ordered the morning glory burger and it was really good. Good size and didn't even need fries to get full. Had a tall beer that was a great compliment.

The price was a little high for the burger alone, but the taste was very good. The lady at the bar was super friendly and attentive (like you would expect for a bartender wanting a tip) there were a ton of different ketchup sauces to use for your burger.. Very creative and tasty. So of you are looking for a quick not too busy place to get a bite to eat this place fit the bill pretty well.

Food great! Service not so great... Sat down in a mostly empty restaurant.. Took 5 minutes to get greeted by bartender. Ordered a vodka soda.. She poured abs charged for top shelf.. Ordered well. Took 15 minutes for my spiked shake. Which I understand takes a while to make. But bartender was busy flirting with BF? Bad experience..

It's in a great location in the miracle mile shopping center and right next to the parking garage so I usually swing by there as I'm passing through. The food is good, quick and there's a good variety of burgers without having too much on the menu. The staff are awesome and friendly. I've read a couple of negative reviews, usually regarding price, but I think people forget they're in Vegas and eating on the Strip. If you don't want to spend money go to McDonalds!
Tip - they have yummy poutine fries here!!!
This place is great they have food and nice selection of alcohol also Brianna is one of the best bartenders in Vegas
Good food, female staff, gloria?!?! has no customer service skills at all. Like zero.

I've been getting down at Ketchup regularly since I discovered it. Here you order and seat yourself until your food is delivered. I like that because I don't have to wait on a waitress to go back and forth from my drink to order and I don't have to get up to grab my food once I'm situated in my seat. They have a pretty good selection of burgers. They offer all sorts of substitution options including a vegetarian patty. Even with odd demands they've gotten them all correct so far so pat on the back to the cooks. I've tried a few different burgers so far and enjoyed them all. Their fries are pretty good too. They have those new touch screen soda fountains with more drink variants than I could mention but for starts all the classic soda, diet soda, and juice type drinks you could possibly need are available at the push of a button. I gotta say the cost to upgrade your burger, which does not include fries and drink, to a meal that does is a bit absurd. My will to eat there unfortunately cannot be supported by my ability to afford it as often as I'd like. I don't expect them to be inexpensive but for the price they are charging for these burgers I would hope fries on the side would be included. Between the food and the price the defining return factor is the customer service. I've been greeted by nothing but smiles and "Welcome"s by counter staff and the lovely lady at the bar. I say they're on the right track to staying in business but I hope they make some small changes to their menu prices.

So one of my friends really wanted beer with her food, so we somehow landed into this restaurant in the Miracle Mile. Let me start by saying I felt the food was way overpriced for what you got. There's also a $15 minimum to use credit cards.

I got the regular ketchup burger and it was okay at best. Along with it ordered onion rings and those weren't good. The dough from the onion rings wasn't crunchy all the way through, the parts closer to the interior tasted very bready which made the onion rings a lot less palatable. They come with a variety of different ketchup flavors but after a while they all started tasting like bad BBQ sauce.

This is just one of those places where I go in, and I know it's probably not going to be that great, but when I actually have it it ends up being worst than I imagined and overpriced to boot.

Started out ok..... Ordered two hamburger meals plus fries and drinks. Ordered a kids meal. Check total 38.00 went back up to ask about a kids drink told kids meal doesn't come with a drink they gave me a water cup. I proceed to put juice in the cup for my two kids to share I was rudely told it was a water only cup. I then pored out the juice. I went back up to inquire about a kids cup told only one size I then asked to cancel my order I can see my food is about done. I will never eat here I had to cancel ove a kids drink... Sounds petty but its more insulting

So PF changs totally did not want to serve me so I walked across the mall and found this place. The lady said she was closed but took my order anyways. She was so pleasant just like the guy who brought me food. Thank you very much guys.
Service is SLOW! Fries were tasty but the chicken wrap is seriously uninspired for the inflated price. Don't be fooled: this isn't the convenient tasty option you seek!

Ketchup wasn't a great burger joint. Located in the Miracle Mile mall at the PH.The place don't have any waitress so you have to order at the counter. The western burger was very bland barley had any bbq sauce in it. My wife crunchy Dog was the opposite it was very salty . There chili cheese fries was ok but way to much beans in the chili .The only thing good was the service. Maybe cause we sat at the bar. Other then that there's way better food in this mall.

The only thing premium about this place is the price they charge for their food.  I opted to go here to use a Groupon and because its location in the Miracle Mile Shops makes it an easy walk from the garage elevators to the restaurant for my wife.

I ordered two burgers--a mushroom and Swiss and a Western.  The mushroom and Swiss was supposed to be medium and the Western was to be rare.  With them, I ordered the soda/fries combo.  All that for a mere $36 including the $20 Groupon.

I went to the self serve area and got three flavors of ketchup.  I tried the balsamic ketchup, the maple bacon ketchup, and the fry sauce.  I also got our two iced teas and napkins.

The orders were brought and the mushroom Swiss was correct by burger was the wrong one so she took it back and eventually brought out a Western.  That's when my disappointment set it.  The burgers were larger and flatter than a hockey puck, but they were really lacking much flavor from the toppings.  They were also very, very dry.  I am a person who very rarely uses ketchup. I think it's a bastard food item meant to hide the taste of things on which it's spread.   When I put some on a burger, you know it's awfully dry and it needs something to make it taste better.  No luck.  It wasn't so dry, but the taste, oh it never was there.  The bacon on my Western was odd.  It was very tough although it had been cooked throughly.

There were a few things that made the experience tolerable.  I liked the women in their short shorts.  They looked quite fine.  The free wifi (well, I guess with the prices you should never refer to it as free wifi) worked well and was zippy.  Ask someone who works there for the password.  The wait for the burger was not long.  How did they overcook the meat that quickly to the point of desert dryness?  It's a puzzlement!  One more thing, the fries were good.

I realize I now have two rules for buying Groupons.  Rule #1:  Always check the Yelp reviews before buying.  Rule #2:  Don't forget Rule #1.  I guess I got to Rule #2 and didn't follow Rule #2.  Fool me once!

There are so many good burger places along the Strip, don't waste your time and money here.  It simply is not worth it.

Went to Ketchup for the first time and honestly I was not impressed. For the quality of the burgers this place is way over priced. Any burger place that I have ever been to where they don't ask me how I want I my burger cooked, ie med, med-well, well done. How can you consider this place PREMIUM burgers? Also the fries are a separate side they do not come as a combo and they don't tell you this until it's time to pay. They have a secret ketchup sauce, it's not too hard to figure out, 60% mayo and 40% ketchup we make that all the time at home.

S-L-O-W

I want to give this place higher than a 2-stars because the food wasn't bad but the service is awfully slow... someone help this one-man show working at the bar, please. It's not his fault, the place just wasn't adequately staffed. We placed our order at the bar. Everyone else working were cooks inside the kitchen, no one else tending the registers. Mind you, the place wasn't that full. We were supposed to grab a quick bite... it was nothing but. Maybe the slow service was just that day... hopefully it's not like that everyday! 

When we finally got to the counter we still had to wait till we can actually place our order. We already knew what we wanted since we had to wait awhile. We had more than enough time to look at the menu over and over. We decided on a Mushroom Swiss and Fries. The burger was delicious, fresh and juicy! Lots of grilled mushrooms and caramelized onions on top of certified angus beef patty, melted Swiss cheese and mayo. 

This burger joint is conveniently located inside the Miracle Mile Shops. As soon as you enter the mall from the parking garage structure it is immediately to your right. The prices are fair and they currently have a Groupon running which we used. The bar has 3 of 4 flat screen TV's. They have regular shakes and spiked ones too.

Review #0949

I initially wanted to go to Gordon Ramsey's Burgr located nearby Planet Hollywood but when I got there was jammed packed line waiting. I couldnt wait since I had a plane to catch.  The people I was with suggested to hit up Ketchup even though it might be up to par to Burgr.

So we walked that way to get there and ordered the High Roller burger made with Kobe beef. The burger and fries were pretty good and fresh. No complaints. Burgr is still better but decent alternative if you cant wait to eat at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr.

I decided to try this for lunch on a Wednesday and only had about a 10 min wait which was nice considering how long the line was.  It was definitely worth the wait.

This was the best burger I've ever had in my life.  I ordered the Wakey Wakey burger and it was the most amazing, flavorful and juicy burger ever.  I ordered fries which were nicely done - crispy but not overdone.  I also had one of the loopy spiked shakes which had crushed fruit loops, and fruit loop vodka!  

I highly recommend this place for a great, reasonably priced burger on the Strip.  

Looking forward to my next visit!
... 22 mins for cold poutine fries and chicken tenders ... used to be the spot to get lunch ... not anymore

Unfortunately the line was too long at BurGR to wait. We stumbled across this place. Very satisfied with the quality & taste of the food. Great place to go if you don't want typical fast food but don't want a restaurant either.

Food is decent, but on the weekends in the early AM they play a lot of music with racial explicits and explicits in general. Wouldn't say it's family friendly on the weekends unless it's not always like that just my experience, but hearing music say racist words over and over is not my idea of a good time.

Eaten here a few times now and only get the fries, the fries are large enough to eat as a meal or share between 2 people.  I'm a big fry person so I usually order the Philly cheesesteak fries as my meal.  I tried the poutine fries but it was a little too heavy for me, definitely loaded with gravy and cheese curds (my fault for ordering that as my meal and not expecting to feel full and bloated afterwards).  Not a fan of ketchup as a condiment but if you are this place has a variety of ketchups for you to choose.  Luckily for those like me they also have "fry sauce".  My loaded philly cheese steak fries already have a ton of toppings on it but I like having the option to dip into the fry sauce.  I usually eat here during my lunch break so never had a chance to order the spiked shakes, wouldn't mind trying this on one of my days off though.  Never had a burger or hot dog here but never disappointed with the fries here.  *they also have a high tech soda fountain with lots of soda flavor choices.

Stopped in today for a little lunch. Walked in and there was no-one there to greet us. The bartender (female) saw us wandering and spoke. Very friendly and handed us a few menus. As we stood there longer wondering where do we order, my husband calls me and says she's here. I walk over to the counter and the cashier (Gloria) is looking in another direction. I stood there and she says nothing so I say "hello", she said hi (dry) and I just started to order. She was not pleasant at all. Matter of fact she gave me the impression that we interrupted her from whatever she was doing. We sat down and when our food was ready, she delivered it and just started handing out food. The burgers were good and the ketchup bar had a variety of flavors however we could not enjoy our meal because of her nasty attitude. The first impression always sets the tone for the meal and she may need to call off if she's not in the best of moods or ask someone else to take orders. It wasn't just me because I asked other customers when they were getting ketchup. Gloria needs to go back to Customer Service 101 training.
Horrible service! Overpriced and staff is very unfriendly. The food was served poorly. Is not worth the money or the time.
Quite yummy.  It's a burger stand, but when you crave a good burger this will hit the spot.  Very clean.  Friendly service.  Bar available.  Good spot to watch a game.

Stopped here for breakfast on our last day here. We had a great experience while having breakfast here. Took a chance and bought a groupon for this place 20 dollars worth of food for 11 bucks. Not a huge menu but if you want a quick bite to eat this might be your place. Conner was our server/manager and we couldn't be more pleased with our visit. Oh and Hence the name ketchup bar you need to try the ketchup that they serve.  It sheds a whole new light on ketchup. SIRACHA WAS THE BEST.  Thanks Conner

Always passed by this place & didn't realize
how amazing it actually is, thanks to T our bartender; who I might add was very helpful & social with us. I do plan on coming back here seeing as they have a great happy hour  as well fast & polite service which I can appreciate! 

I do recommend ketchup to those are either visiting & or are locals because of it's location on the strip/close to the garage who is convenient to myself & friends

Was super hungry after landing in Vegas and this was one of a few close by our hotel. I ordered a burger that had avocado and beans, kind of chosen the wrong one. Damn I just saw avocado and ordered. For me, there's really nothing special about it. Meat was a little bit on the dry side.

We ate here because we were STARVING..and honestly we only wanted to get a glance at Sausage from Ink Master at club tattoo across the way. Lol. 

I got the classic. Not the best burger I've ever had, but my friend got the bleu cheese burger which was amazeballlllls. I wish I would've gotten that instead. 

All the different ketchups were yummy and fun. I ended up mixing the Fancy Sauce (my Stepbrothers reference) with the sriracha ketchup. The smokey one was really good too. 

Oh and for the love, SPLIT a burger with someone. Make it a basket and you've got a meal for 2. 

And we never saw Sausage.

Came twice during my trip. Friday night/Saturday morning at like 3am, Sam was amazing! Really exceptional service.

Sunday early afternoon, Amber was managing/bartending and was personable, anticipated our needs, and provided great recommendations. To top it off, the food was delicious! Would definitely come back and recommend!

Loved this place. Yes it is expensive but it's vegas so what do you expect? Staff was super friendly and helpful. I got the classic burger which was delicious. Large basket of fries is enough to share with 3 or more people. Great food, great atmosphere. Would definitely come back here again.
Was really in the mood for fries so I came to ketchup to buy the regular garlic fries with Parmesan. These were absolutely horrendous , they were burnt hard and not worth the money At all

This is the spot to filll your stomach on the cheap in vegas.  Been there twice.  Once we got an order of fries and the other time a side of fried pickled.  Both times we were surprised by the size and quality of the item. Service was great both times.  We will be back!

The customer service here is some of the best I've had in Vegas. They ran out of something & went above & beyond to make up for it. This place is a really great little stop in Miracle Mile. The food is simple but good. The cocktails are super yummy. But more than anything the customer service blew me away. Every staff member we interacted with was absolutely lovely. I will definitely come back every time I'm in Vegas. I highly recommend the Vegas Dogs & Fruit Loop cocktails.
Horrible tasting burger, felt sick to my stomach. Chili cheese fries were ok. Wouldn't recommend it!

With my husband being a huge fan of Ketchup, we just had to stop in and try their premium burgers and huge assortment of ketchups!  Our burgers were juicy and cooked to order and really good!  I choose the Big Bleu which had crispy bacon, blue cheese and caramelized onions.  My husband ordered the Western burger - again crispy bacon, cheddar cheese, onion crisps and a BBQ ketchup.  Both of us had fries so we can check out the ketchup bar and the fries were well seasoned and hot and crispy!  The ketchup bar... wow!  You name it - they have it.  I can't remember all of them but our top 2 were the BBQ ketchup and the maple bacon ketchup.  I remember also a curry ketchup, balsamic ketchup, and a fry sauce.  Be sure to try them all and find your fave!  This was a cool atmosphere and the staff was very nice and helpful.

I don't know why they bother. It's about specialty Ketchups, hence the name. Out of many and very messy too.
Don't know why they ask how you want it cuz you're getting it well done...so much for my medium rare order.
Over priced...for that you can hit up Ramsey's Place. 
Really ticked they wouldn't let us take advantage of the BOGO Hot Dogs...the Groupon says $20 worth of food...any food! 
Difficult to find...all the way in the back. I was worn out from walking that far.
Didn't incur the water disaster but if I did I would have told them where to stick it.

Located towards the back of Planet Hollywood. I was suuuper hungry and decided to settle for this place. A milkshake, large fries, and a burger came out to be $24... TWENTY FOUR DOLLARS. Just shoot me now. This wasn't how I imagined to spend my money in Vegas. The wait was pretty long too for food and to order...

On the side, you can get your soda and a variety of ketchups. There were garlic, sriracha, balsamic, chipotle, jalapeno, and hickory. I tried the garlic and hickory, neither of which I fancied... Very faint flavoring

My friend and I shared a Mac Attack comboed with large Garlic Parm Fries and Oreo Milkshake. I have to hand it to them, the milkshake was pretty bomb. It's more ice cream than milk, which I prefer. It's nothing like a McFlurry. The Mac Attack was super oily and pretty small... Not a lot of flavor in it either. I need more aioli. The fries were crispy, which is a plus, and not very garlicky. It was a pretty huge portion. My friend and I weren't able to finish the large fries so I recommend a regular size.

All in all, this was a pretty expensive meal... I can't imagine the bill that large family next to us had to pay...
Thought I try it out and it was but not great just average.  A little high in price for what it was. Service very good but I will pass next time.

I wish I could give this a better rating because the morning glory burger I had was pretty good actually. The patty was a little over cooked and the egg on the burger was overlooked as well.

When I asked for water, they said I had to get it from the bar. Couldn't get it from the soda machine for some reason. So there is only one girl working at the bar and she is busy pouring drinks so I wait for a couple minutes and ask for some water. When we go to get a refill because it's a small plastic cup. It's another few minute wait while our food is over there getting cold. There is a much better method to this. Have a self serve water tap and/or put water in the soda machine.

The food here isn't fantastic but early in the morning when you need to get some breakfast before you head out somewhere this does the trick. It is one of the very few places that is open in the mall in the early morning and serves breakfast. The breakfast menu is very limited, only 5 items. The food was as expected. Not the best every but it did the job.

We have alway walked by this place at the Miracle Mile Shops and kept saying we would try it, well we decided to try it out. They had a lot on the menu to choose from, but seemed a little pricey. Everything was al a cart....  We got our good, the burgers were very greasy and tasted like they were frozen and over cooked, very dry and bland, the fries were okay but tased over cooked as well. The atmosphere was not the best here, at least we tried the place but McDonalds burgers are better then here.

Here's the thing the burgers were good, fries good. No complaints on the food, however this place advertises Heinz ketchup all throughout the store. All over the walls, outside the trash cans are shaped like and say Heinz! But!!!!!!!! They only offer Heinz small packets. You know the ones you get with take out food? We saw a guy unpacking hunts ketchup and the supply cabinet is out in the open and there was no Heinz to be found!!! Pretty odd to use the Heinz brand and not their product lol!!! So those fancy ketchups they have, are made with hunts not Heinz! For me, being from Pennsylvania, we Pennsylvania people know the difference of ketchup since Heinz is made in Pittsburgh, Pa. I just was disappointed that they advertise a brand but don't actually use it. What else are they fibbing about ? The burgers may not even be angus beef ahhhhhh!!!

I wouldn't recommend eating at this place. I ordered our food, tried to find a clean table...no luck. I opted for one that was half clean. Then I noticed a guy come out to bus tables. I figured, OK, I'll get a clean table when he's done. I watched this guy go over to a table and clean it off with a napkin that was left on the table. The same guy was wiping out baskets that they put food in and stacking them with a piece of paper between and let me tell you, he was not concerned about getting anything clean. My wife went up and demanded our money back and we left. Sorry!

Went here for dinner after flying into Vegas and had the Western burger with chicken. Burger was covered in grease, but still delicious and the hickory ketchup was amazing.

The food +beer was a little on the pricey side, but it's Vegas and I'm expecting everything to be on the pricey side. Bartender was awesome, kept up a good flow of conversation and even slid over some free shots of fireball infused smoothies.

Located in the Miracle Mile Shops inside of The Planet Hollywood Hotel Casino on the Famous Las Vegas Strip.
Three big things! One: They have all manor of ketchups. Two: They are reasonably priced for a strip restaurant. Three: I had a hamburger with hot dog on top of it. Let me repeat that I had a hamburger with hot dog on top of it. These people are not fooling around. Make sure to stop by for great Tuesday specials and great happy Hour Deals! Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

We love trying new burger places, so landed here when hungry and shopping.  The thing here is ketchup.  We both ordered the standard cheeseburger (that comes with, you guessed it ketchup) and a side of tots to share.  The burger was decent and the bartender who was serving us brought a caddy of different flavors of ketchup... hickory, chipotle, sarachi, jalapeño, garlic and one other I can't remember.  The burger itself was really nothing stand out.  It was weird because part of my patty was medium and the other part bordering on rare... same with my husbands.  Anyway, not bad but not great.  Staff was semi-friendly.  One and only time here... too many choices on the strip to accept okay service and burgers.
I got a classic burger. It was really good. They did however, take foreverrrrrr!

The place was not busy but our 3 burgers took over 40 mins to get. The manager was working the bar and was extremely nice and apologized many times but of course they may have been understaffed. The food sucked so all in all this place was a disaapoinment except for the nice manager.

$17 Burger Gone Wrong!!!!

My boyfriend and I walked by and decided to try something new. We both got the Ketchup Classic Burger with French Fries. We had high expectations due to much higher prices. After taking the first bite, instant disatisfaction. The meat patty had no taste, not even the ketchup can save it - reminds me of a McDonald's quarter pounder, just ten times the price. Their French Fries are tasteless, not fresh, and dry. We were so hungry but the food is so bad that we threw away more than half of it. Honestly, In N Out Burger wins this place ten times over and ten times cheaper!!!
This place is excellent. Great, fresh, delicious burgers. Amazing sweet potato fries. Generous portions and fast service. We've been here several times and never had anything less than perfection.

If you are looking for a heart attack have one of their burgers.  Food is super greasy but definately satisfies a craving for a burger.  They had a whole array of ketchup flavors to choose from and same with coca cola products.  It's a bit pricey, but i expected that because it is located in planet hollywood on the strip.  It's an ok place but there are so many burger joints around that it's not really that much different than any other.

Craving some burger and fries at 1am and ketchup premium burger fulfilled that desire...... at a really slow rate.

Food was actually decent and fries were good. Only.. it took a while for me to actually receive my food. 

Decently priced burgers though. The employees were friendly.

I was very impressed!! Food was about $11/burger on average but was well worth it!!
I loved this place. Will definitely recommend and will definitely be back!! Staff were very attentive and polite as well...

This review based on tonight's experience while waiting for our food to be served.

First and foremost, the evening staff SUCKS! It's as if everyone hates their job here, including the crappy manager, who I respectfully asked if they can replace the garlic ketchup. 

His response "we only make enough ketchup to last the day" 

How is your company named "Ketchup PREMIUM Burger Bar" but I have yet to see the premium, and the ketchup bar is 50% empty. Come on, quit your job if you can't provide good customer service. 

To the owner: you should expect a vast amount of foot traffic being at the entrance to the parking garage on a Friday night, but I see exactly why people go to the BURGR joint at the casino, who will wait in line for the extensive customer service. You should witness the staff for yourself and see why you're losing easy money in a hotel that's full of local and tourist shoppers. 

Waiter just walked up to me and gave me honesty by saying "the girls in the back are very backed up but they can work on making more ketchup in a bit, I will let you know when they do" 

I'll take honesty over a bull sh!t excuse that they only make enough sauce to last a day, on a flipping Friday dude. Come on. Lamest excuse ever from a MANAGER. 

AND THATS JUST A REVIEW FOR SERVICE.

The food: 
I got the loco moco. I love egg on my burgers, but even my wife agrees with her ketchup class burger that the food tastes rushed. I would rather have a nice drive thru burger from Wendy's than this joke. 

Don't come here and waste your money. The good reviews are probably from drunk tourist, who don't know burgers.

2014 YELP 365 CHALLENGE - 92/365

We stopped by Ketchup to grab a bite to eat and I got the Western Burger. The burger was pretty good but the buns were SO greasy. I like that they have the Coca Cola machine so you can fill up with whatever you like. For the price, it was an overall OK experience. PS. We were all wondering what was up with the sad depressing break up songs blasting from the bar! WTF!

I came here and had the veggie burger with a side of sweet potato fries. I wish the food had wow'ed me more, it wasn't bad by any means, but if I am paying $18 for a burger and some fries I want a little more pizzazz. That being said, it is in a casino/hotel, so I shouldn't have been surprised. 
The staff was young and not necessarily focused on hospitality. I have a feeling if I had needed something beyond the norm it would not have met my standards. 
I probably wouldn't come back just based on the price and value comparison- but I don't regret the meal.

I used a Living Social voucher just to try out this place since I was staying at the Elara Hilton Grand Vacations next to the Miracle Mile Shops. We ordered 2 burgers and an onion ring for $33.00. The food was good but, for the price I expected a WOW factor. They should have a person running out the food. The cashier was busy with a line of customers wanting to order and also running out the food in between taking orders. The food may sit in the heat window until she can get a chance to deliver your food. We tried it and probably won't be back.

We came here after a show and there was literally 5 people in the entire place and we still had to wait 20+Min for our food which I thought was rather annoying. In addition, the prices are definitely on the steep side.    I did however really enjoy my burger. It definitely is a huge portion.  The guy behind the counter was nice and chill.      All in all,  i probably would come back if I was at planet hollywood to give it a 2nd chance.    my only concern is   how  much longer my burger times would've took if they were actually busy tho.

I ordered the expensive Kobe Beef $16 burger. Tough and overcooked. Being I was the second customer of the morning means they couldn't use the excuse they were too busy to get it right. The additional mushrooms I ordered on it were borderline burnt. I happen to be a Burger Conneseur, so, for what it's worth, I would've done better going to In-n-Out. Also, their salted pretzel milk shake tasted good at first, but if you let it sit for a few minutes the pretzel bits turn soggy and tasted like wet bread. Blech! I could only drink half of it before it grossed me out. Otherwise, if you're drunk and later in the evening like most people are, you wouldn't care. 

The service was practically non-existent other than them bringing the order to your table. I'm glad I didn't tip at the cashier because I would've regretted it. I tip for service so I refuse to tip someone standing at the counter doing their job. She gave me a scowl like she was expecting it.

The fries are awful! I had the bacon cheese fries and it was really sloppy, not good at all! The service is slow, we waited over 15 minutes for our food to come out and the place wasn't busy at all. The service is lacklustre and unfriendly. There are plenty of other places to get better food, I wouldn't bother with Ketchup again.
Don't come here unless you are wanting to pay 3 dollars for water, as its no longer free. Or a five dollar soda... or a 15 dollar mediocre burger. Disappointed, is a understatement.

Used a groupon and first time there. Starts with bartender welcoming us then because we said we wanted to sit at a table she got a crabby.  With a rude tone said we will have to come to her if we want any drinks. We didn't but might of if we didn't get that attitude. 

Then go to use groupon at the counter and the amount over was less than 15 so she wouldn't let me use card. Finally got our food and it was ok but nothing special. Was for sure not worth the 35 it would have cost for chicken strips, union rings, a hotdog, shake and drink.

Place looked nice but they don't run it very well.

Went there today, 6/28/14.
Service was disappointing for numerous reasons. The girls who take your order not welcoming (it's your job whether you like it or not the least you could do is welcome your customers with a smile), they delivered the wrong order to our table three times, saw at least three of the servers do this to other tables as well (know what your customers order especially when there is only a handful), this blond server had the worst attitude tossed our fried pickles and rolled her eyes when I stated, "No, I ordered the ketchup classic" I gave her no attitude not sure why she felt it necessary to roll her eyes and walk away instead of apologizing.

The attire worn by the servers was unacceptable. I would not allow it in my establishment. The server had on shorts that looked like old worn out pajama shorts that clearly showed she had nothing under. Hooters should be their attire standard just so they have some sort of guideline. Those girls tend to have the appropriate coverage and much neater shorts.  

Enough about experience...

Food was bland. Buns, patty and fried pickles nothing special and not worth the $, although the ketchup was tasty I will not be returning. Fried pickles way better than the burger I'd give them a 6/10 still not enough to bring me back. Food looks great but the taste was overall disappointing. 
Asked my friend who I was there with what she thought... She also was displeased.

Tried this fast food sit down with a groupon. You definitely need a groupon deal to come here. Don't waste your money on food you can BBQ at home. The food is super over priced. On a brighter note, they have a variety of burger flavors to choose from. Food was pretty good, hence the 2 stars.

I got a turkey burger and strawberry shortcake alcoholic milkshake, my boyfriend got a burger and fruit loops milkshake. My burger was okay, turkey burgers are usually hit or miss, but she let me make a few substitutions which was nice. My boyfriend loved his burger. However, after getting our burgers we wondered where our drinks were. The cashier didn't tell us that after ordering and paying we had to go to the bar and ask the bartender to make our drinks.

Speaking of the drinks, they were delicious! His shake tasted just like fruit loops but I have to say that my strawberry shortcake shake was even better. I would recommend that two people split a shake though if you're both getting a burger (or sharing a burger if you're both getting a shake?), the combination left me so full.

This place was pretty good! We got a Groupon, so we had to give it a try. It has a cool vibe and there are a lot of tables, so didn't have to worry about seating. We sat at the bar so we could watch football and the bartender was very friendly.

My fiance got the Big Blue Burger and I ordered a Grilled Cheese, we shared the Blue Cheese Buffalo Fries. The food was good! The burger tasted fresh and was served hot (I hate being served cold food, so that made me happy) the Grilled Cheese was pretty good too, but the cheese wasn't real, think Kraft ... But didn't expect real cheese anyway, just an FYI. The prices are expensive .. $6 for a plain old grilled cheese. The side of fries were like $7.99 .... The burger $10 which was kind of reasonable ... I don't know, everything is expensive on the Strip I guess. 

The sriracha  ketchup, tasty! Place was clean, we would maybe come back if we return to Vegas.

Skip this place.  Overpriced (what restaurant on the strip isn't over priced?) for not so great of food.
The food is average at best. Kinda bland.
The adding of seasoning to the ketchup didn't work.  Nothing special.
Would not recommend this restaurant. 
Keep walking the mile and find something else!
Quick service, juicy Hawaiian, tasty bacon cheddar fries. MacNCheese, western, classic burger were dry. Would give it another chance and come back.

Ketchup burger bar is located right in front of the miracle mile parking lot, a very convenient spot, so I decided to give it a try. I ordered the mushroom burger combo meal ($16) for my wife and western burger combo meal ($17) for myself. The burger is good but not good enough for $33. It tastes exactly like "Carls Jr". Luckily I bought a $22 gift cert for $11 at amazon local. So including the tax and tip and the amazon local gift cert, the meal is just under $30.

This is probably a 3.5 star review due to the service, but I can't bump it all the way to 4.  We had just been at the Elite Event at Koi and were still hungry, so we decided to split a burger and some fries to finish the evening.  We split the Big Bleu, a burger with bacon, bleu cheese, and caramelized onions.  The bun was soft, but the patty was very overcooked.  No pink at all.  I pointed this out, noting that it was overcooked but it was fine, we'd eat it.  The bartender got us another burger without us asking for it.  She just had the kitchen wrap it up to take it home with us, which we appreciated.  

We also split the poutine, the rich French fry dish topped with brown gravy and cheese curds.  The gravy was solid in taste, but a little thin.  Had some issues adhering to the fries.  Also, I could have used more cheese curds.  In other versions of this dish there is a lot more cheese.  That being said, the salty fries went great with the brown gravy and cheese.  I'd get this again.

Of the flavored ketchups, my favorites were the hickory and the balsamic.  You could bottle that balsamic and I'd gladly pay for it.  These were interesting additions, and frankly, it's something I'm surprised more places haven't tried.  Maybe I'm just going to the wrong places...

We sat at the bar, and the service was great.  Very friendly bartender and decent beer selection.  I think if they work out the cooking issues with the meat, this place can do well and is a solid addition to the mall at Planet Hollywood.

Really high priced burgers for low end burgers and you have to pay 5 more for a combo it's not the cheapest eat in Vegas just the cheapest eat in planet Hollywood mall with horrible staff and serve yourself to tip them for nothing at the counter. Staff is not even happy at work and terribly rude when she was the one who messed up the order. Please just eat at chipotle when it opens at least you're guaranteed a certain quality of food. Worst 15 burger combo I spent.

I always pass by this place, when we stay at Planet Hollywood. Finally got a chance to stop by for dinner tonight.
You place your order at the counter,
Get an order number, 
& your order will be brought to table. 
This place is located at 410 at the Miracle Mile shops
There are weekly specials, Tuesdays: buy one get one free hot dogs. ( Which they ran out of) 
My opinion: this place is a bit pricey!! 
Burger does not come with fries.
We got 2 burgers, 
Gordon Blue Burger: 12.05-w/out fries.
Buffalo chicken sandwich-12.30. 
(Comes with 2 piece of chicken tender on a bun, along with feta cheese, buffalo sauce, lettuce, & tomato)
I did not like the feta cheese!! -I'm not sure if this is a mistake? It doesn't go well together! 
I paid 4.00 more to make it a combo. 
The fries were small portions!! 
Over-all our burger was mediocre!!
The prices you pay for burger is not worth the price!! 

The 2 reason that I enjoy most about this place:
1. The soda machine, I call it the iPad soda machine, it's pretty cool dispensing the drinks. Just press the category and the type of drinks you would like and your drink will be ready. I got a Fanta Orange with sprite drink.
2. I like the concept of ketchup, this is why the place is called ketchup-premium. I like that there are many different flavored ketchup. Ex. Spiracha ketchup, hickory ketchup, buffalo ketchup. 

It was an experience!! I will be back for the fries & ketchup & the fountain drinks!! Maybe the burgers!?
Great burgers !! Love the ketchup bar, different flavor for every burger bite :)   Generous portion of fries and the Bloody Mary was delicious !
I had the burger with fried mac and cheese, amazing! They have tons of sauces to choose from. All were delicious. Can't wait to try again!

Delicious! Burgers are huge and cooked to perfection. Loved the maple ketchup (even used some on my burger) We used a Groupon and didn't get any push back from the server. Just a FYI you CAN NOT combine a groupon w/ the special of the day :) We'll definitely be back!

Rip Off !!! Had eaten there a couple years ago and thought the price was reasonable and food decent. So we visited there restaurant again on another trip to Las Vegas, in mid May 2018. We failed to get a copy of the receipt but when I saw the charge on my credit card statement it was $44, for two ($10) burgers with fries and 2 soft drinks. We clearly were overcharged. I called the restaurant several times and they would promise to look into it and clear it up/refund any overcharge. However they blew us off, i stopped calling after my 3rd call to them. To this day June 4th I have not heard back from them. They are a 'Rip Off' I do not recommend them.

1/27 - Bought the Groupon offer to save some $$. Pricey entrees but we're in LV right? It was Tuesday so it was BOGO on all hot dogs. Ordered 1 chili-cheese dog and 1 with onion bits. Side of sweet potato fries and a couple of sodas. Although the table service was good, the waitress/cashier failed to tell us our Groupon was not good for the free hot dog offer. Eh! Whatever! We won't be back again anyway....

I'm starting this right off the bat, this place was horrible I have never experienced food quality and service as I did at this place. The burger patty was uncooked like I just paid over $35 for two meals and they give me uncooked meat that's so ridiculous!. I obviously let them know what was going on and they gave me a refund but trust me I will never be coming here again. So if you are thinking about it let me tell you it's not worth it.

I've heard about this place before I got to Vegas and wanted to try it. It's located at the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. It was easier to find than I thought. After you park the car and enter from the back, it's the first thing you see to your right.

We got there pretty late, around 8 or 9pm. There were two other tables being occupied, so it was dead. We walked up to the counter and put in our orders. There was a young teenage boy working the cashier and he was helpful. I asked about the different burgers and he explained them to me.

I chose the Big Bleu Burger and upgraded to a meal for $4.39 more, which came with fries and a drink. The hubby had the Ketchup Classic and subbed the beef patty for the chicken breast. My Big Bleu was so delicious! It was an angus beef patty, topped with bleu cheese, bacon, caramelized onion, and garlic aioli. I was going to put one of their fancy ketchups on it, but I didn't have to. It was perfect on its own.

The reason I wanted to try this place was because of all their different ketchups, hence the name. They have four ketchups to be exact with two sauces: buffalo sauce, fry sauce, hickory ketchup, balsamic ketchup, original ketchup, and sriracha ketchup.

The hickory ketchup had a burnt taste to it. The balsamic was sweet and the siriracha was spicy. My two favorites were the balsamic and the fry sauce. The fry sauce went great with the fries. It was like the Thousand Island dressing with a hint of sweetness to it.

Okay in a pinch, but rather lackluster on the whole- from burger to service, it was all rather "meh"- 
Easily forgettable in a city that has so much to offer, even just for a quick bite.

The BUNS! i think that was the best part of the burger. Super soft chewy buns ! Had the mushroom swiss burger and the western one (had onion rings and bacon in it). And the sauce selection was bomb digs! They even have the nifty coke machine with a bajillion flavors. I would totally go back!

Nice place in the miracle mile shop mall. Staff friendly and helpful. They have a condiment bar that allows you to get whatever type of condiment you desire.
Kinda pricey $70 for four people just burgers and fries and no drinks

this place is okay. just okay. the fried pickles are just the peelings of the pickles, you can see that when you eat them. so they use the actual pickles for burgers and the outside for fries. the milk shake was not very good. we got the Oreo one and it was below expectations. especially for the strip. it just tasted like whip cream and the Oreos were barely crushed so it was hard to drink. I definitely won't be coming back here.

The Ketchup Bar is an average restaurant.  The service representatives are kind and helpful.  After that, you might as well turn around.  So here is my breakdown in my review:

1. You must bring cash.  The only way that you may use your debit card or credit card is if you have a transaction higher than $15.
2.  A 22 ounce milkshake with absolutely no left overs is $7.17
3.  A single patty cheese burger is $9.19; and a ultimate chesse burger  is $18.00
4. A side of fries is $3.00; and a basket of fries is $5.00

So, ultimately two of use slip a ultimate cheese burger,  a basket of fries and two glasses of water for a total of $24.00 .  My overall suggestions is to take the walk to Gordon Ramsey's  Burger restaurant  or find a Fudruckers.

What really caught my eye were the different kinds of ketchup they had!! Sriracha, balsamic, hickory...super unique!
I seriously think this place is underrated because their burgers were amazing! I had the Wakey wakey which i loved esp because there was an egg, bacon, and sweet potato fries in it.
Their burgers are HUGE so watch out! 
Oh and they have groupon deals, i got twenty dollars worth of food for ten bucks!

$24.99 family meal is worth it and delicious. My favorite item without a doubt has to be the French fries. They're seasoned and fried very well. The BBQ ketchup go well with them, too. The cheeseburger is average and by that I mean tasty.

Ketchup Premium Burger Bar is located inside the Miracle Mile Shops and immediately accessible when arriving through the entrance from the parking garage. I bought a Groupon and ended up paying about $16 total for two people, so kuddos to the Ketchup Bar for letting me and the hubby enjoy an affordable dinner on the Strip. The Ketchup Premium Burger Bar is a casual burger fast food restaurant/sports bar. You walk right up to the front counter and place your order, then are handed a number and seat yourself. 

The food took longer than expected, but we amused ourselves in the meantime by watching highlights of the recent Heats game. When the food arrived, we were all disappointed to learn that our burgers did not come with cheese. I ordered the Veggie Burger ($11.99) and my husband ordered the Ketchup Burger (8.99). For those prices, I think we were justified in assuming the burgers would come with cheese. I really liked my burger- it was crisp on the outside and appeared to be made of a medley of veggies, a refreshing change from the usual black bean or Boca burgers. My husband and the other couple we were with, however, were not impressed with their burgers. They complained that it lacked flavor and was dry. Everyone agreed that the fries were awesome, though. The interesting ketchup flavors, like siracha and balsamic, made the fries even better. 

The customer service is minimal but agreeable. The only interaction you really have with employees is the cashier who takes your order. The cashier was super friendly. She waited patiently while I struggled to pull up my Groupon on my phone. When I told her the Internet service was being horrendously slow, she gave me the WiFi password and instantly fixed the problem.  

I would come back for a veggie burger, but my favorable opinion of the Ketchup Bar was overruled by the 3 other people I was with. Unless you have the Groupon deal, the steep prices are hard to justify. The pricey burgers do not come with fries or a drink, but to be fair everything is overpriced on the Strip.

We had an early dinner here in December and wanted to see the Beatles at the Mirage later.  Ketchup is conveniently located in the attached mall to our hotel at the Alara and something affordable as a quick bite.  It's kind of like a Johnny Rockets, but has various Ketchup flavors to use on your burgers.  It was just okay, but I think the name conjures up something other than hamburgers.  For the money, I would have been just as happy at In-N-Out down the street.

While not the best quality, it has an amazing menu ranging from spiked milkshakes to burgers  loaded with fired mac n cheese to poutine, being the reason I topped in.
Prices are ok given the area, service was super nice, no line, fast service and loved the ketchup bar with all the unique flavors.
The poutine the worst I have ever had.
Fries, gravy and cheddar, where are the cheese curds? And I am missing the meat, they were lackluster gravy fries, still good, just by now means poutine.
Knowing that would be a meal in itself I went with a salad and added a veggie burger patty instead of getting the veggie burger itself.
Descent size salad, pretty good veggie patty, thick and loaded with veggies, fried nicely, though comes in frozen, not made in house.
The mac and cheese burger, huge and the best thing here. My husband had the hangover burger which he also enjoyed as well as the philly fries which were again not that great in quality.
Not a fan of cheese sauce, these would have been much better with real cheddar.
In all a descent meal for a better price than most other burger places in casinos, but no reason to come back.

We were in Vegas for a week and we stayed at the Elara hotel which leads right into Miracle Mile. We'd frequently come back late at night and find this place open so it became our go-to spot for our late night meal. The burgers are delicious and the french fries are perfect. The best part is the owner is as nice as can be. He appreciated us constantly coming back and treated us to free drinks at the bar. Make sure you check this place out!

Burgers were delicious...and BIG!  Fries were also on point. Friendly service. Gave a generous military discount. Was open late which was perfect. Husband got a hotdog and really enjoyed it and daughter got a grilled cheese and devoured it. Highly recommend!

Bugera was "ok". Nothing extra special. Sides are HUGE! Two people can share a side. We made the mistake of upgrading burger to meal with drink & tater tot and we got chili cheese fries...wayyy too much food. Service was great. The 2 guys working were very nice.

Ordered mushroom swiss burger, protein style (no bun) with a side of fries and a soda.  fries were a huge portion, they had different dipping sauces.  burger was great although a bit too pink for what I typically eat.  noone asked me how I liked it cooked so this must be their style of doing it. 
one tip:  the burger was extremely salty.  it wasn't the cheese, onions, or mushrooms so it had to be the burger.  

we would come back again if the salt factor was modified.

We decided to stop for some fries for a quick snack. My friend James decided to order a Mac attack burger and I just ordered the fries. Even tho I order the fries before my friend they came out five minutes after my friends burger and fries. It was twenty minutes just to get fries. When they came out they were cold and hard. In the twenty minutes we waited they received maybe a couple orders but the guy who was running the food decided to take a phone call on his cell phone which is really ridiculous.

Really yummy! Customize options make it my kind of spot! Flavor 5 stars, regular American meat Swiss no bun with extra cheese and bacon! It made me happy and full for my 10mile hike to find our hotel again... that mall is way bigger than you may realize. but bartender come on man, atleast smile joke around. Good concept, delicious!!

We got a groupon to try this place out.  There is no other discounts accepted with the groupon, so even after we chose to do the buy one get one free hot dog, we got charged for the second hot dog, there goes the groupon savings.

The food was just OK, the kids wanted shakes.  Great shakes, but very over priced at $8.

The hot dog was good, but the Hawaiian Burger was bland.  The steak burger patty was thick, but didn't have any flavor.

Very disappointed in the service and food, go to Burgr instead.  A little pricey, but well worth it!

You should only eat here if you want to pay a lot of money for flavorless burgers. 

I was here with a group of 7 and each of us ordered something different, but we all agreed the burgers were bland. But I guess they do have a lot of choices and options for burgers, sides and drinks though. And at least the fries were crispy?

Had a Groupon and wanted to try this place out. The place makes ordering very simple and offers a bar to sit at if you want to drink while eating.  We ordered a turkey burger, swiss burger, and sweet potato fries. The wait was short and the food was served hot and tasted fresh. I would recommend this place of you're ever in Planet Hollywood.

We always pass by this place in PH's Miracle Mile, and thought maybe one day we'll try it because of the cute Heinz ketchup bottle trashcans. The place was always empty, but can't be TOO bad, right?

That day came this weekend when we saw a sign at the sport's memorabilia shop across from Ketchup that said Mike Tyson was doing a meet a greet. We got there a bit early to scope it out, and since there was no lines, we looked for places to eat for lunch. Ketchup was the closest.

We ordered the LA Dog and Ketchup Classic Burger. For being a self proclaimed "premium burger bar", I was surprised they didn't ask how I wanted my burger cooked. I guess well done it is. 

Didn't get to try my bf's hotdog (he said it's fine), but my burger was surprising OK! They have a selection of flavored ketchups by the counter, and my burger went well with the garlic ketchup. Burgers were a good size for a quick lunch, but were pricey for foodcourt-like ambiance.

Service at the cashier was abysmal. The girl looked like she hated her job or we did something to offend her. We ordered in, and she didn't give us a number for our order (everyone else had one). I asked if we needed one and she gave me some random one off the counter with the blankest look on her face. OK? My apologies for trying to make your jobs easier. (BTW, the number didn't do a thing; they still didn't know where to deliver the food esp since it didn't correspond to anything!)

Also, Mike Tyson was a no show for the meet and greet across from Ketchup. Just the cherry we needed to top off our mediocre experience at the Miracle Mile that day. 

Won't be returning to Ketchup. If you want burgers at PH, please go to GR's Burgr just a few steps away in the same hotel. Well worth the few extra dollars for real premium and real service.
Felt like it is a little expensive for what it is, but we did like our food. Classic burgers and fries.

Randomly came here for breakfast at 7am and it was so good! Super flavorful and very reasonable prices. I do wish the breakfast menu had a little more to it but they do still serve the lunch / dinner menu in the morning. Now, I wouldn't say it's the healthiest food but it was darn good! Worth every calorie. 

We sat at the bar and the bartender, Sam, was great. He was very friendly and asked how our trip had been etc. and was attentive from beginning to end. 

Chili cheese fries and grilled cheese were fire and the breakfast sandwich was one of the best I've had. Awesome experience, we will definitely be back next time we come out to visit.

The burger meat is completely flavorless and nearly inedible. The rolls were nice but they had a thick layer of butter on them. The other ingredients were fresh, but this wasn't a quality burger as a whole.
Poutine was alright but instead of using cheese curds they opted for cheaper slices of Swiss cheese which was a bit gross. You might pay a bit more elsewhere but I wouldn't waste a meal on this place if you're just visiting the area.

Fantastic burgers at over $10 each...but not bad for Las Vegas.  

Full bar ready to intoxicate 

Cute wait staff.   What more could one want?

I've been to Ketchup Premium Burger Bar before and it was phenomenal. This time around it wasn't that good. The main selling point for Ketchup Premium Burger Bar is that they carry different flavors of ketchup. This last visit, the ketchup selection was low and not as impressive as my previous visit. I think they only had  four different ketchups to choose from: regular ketchup; hickory; siracha; and buffalo sauce.  I ordered the Big Bleu Burger and the burger itself did not taste fresh, it tasted like it was frozen prior to cooking. The only saving grace for this restaurant was the bartender, she was awesome and made drinks pretty fast. I don't think I will be coming back to Ketchup Premium Burger Bar and wouldn't be surprised if the restaurant closed down.
Over priced bland food. tight tops and short shorts don't distract from the fact that the meal took forever to be prepared. As for the DIFFRENT types of ketchup? They all tasted the same!!!

This place is fantastic!  The adult shakes are amazing, definitely try the pretzel one!  The mac attack burger was so good, i could have eaten a whole bowl of the mac and cheese!  The many flavors of ketchup are also really cool!  Try the maple bacon!

We went to planet Hollywood for BurGR, but the wait was too long so we ended up here. Upon entering I already had a bad feeling..seriously why did I eat here?! Looked at the menu and automatically thought it was boring. Ended up with a wakey wakey and a chocolate pretzel shake. Got the burger but my shake was no where to be seen. Not to mention they wouldn't let my friend swap her soda for a shake even tho she had the money to pay the difference. I mean what is that about? Anyways I told the waitress about the missing shake and she looked lost. When she finally brought it she still didn't know where to put it. Thennn she tried to give us someone else's milkshake! Come on girl! Put those damn boobs away and pick up a book! 

Now onto the food..my burger didn't have a lot of flavor except for the ham. Hell I couldn't even taste the actual burger patty. I also forgot that there was an egg because it had no flavor. That to me is just odd.. As for the shake all I could taste was the pretzel. 

This place lacks in customer service and flavor!

I have wanted to try this place every time I walked by it at the Mircale Mile Mall, just never stopped in, I kinda wish I didn't this time. The burger was suppose to be "well done" but it looked like it just came out of the microwave, it was cooked but not looking like it was done, and also it was VERY greasy I mean by the time I had it half way gone there was literally a puddle of grease in my basket. I only ate it because one I was hungry and two I don't like to not eat something I paid for. Also don't get the "sweet potatoe fries" might as well have been just a regular French fry with the orange tint of sweet potatoe. There was absolutely NO flavor to them at all. I didn't even finish this. They were not tasteful at all. The place usually always looks dead in there that should've been my first hint not to go but I'm willing to try new places and then review them of course! I would not recommend this place to anyone unless you want to pay extra for a la carte it was NOT worth the price that is for sure...

Decor: 4/5
-Order at the counter and have the food served to you
-So many choices of Ketchup!

Service: 5/5
-Super fast preparation. We waited 5-7 minutes for our order, there were 2 orders ahead of ours
-Compared to Gordon Ramsey Burger was a 45 min wait and 45 mins for food preparation

Food: 3.5/5
-Mac Attack Burger - this was a legit flavor bomb burger. We weren't asked how the burger was made. It came out medium yet still juicy, tender and flavorful. I would highly recommend this.
-Pizza burger - I love pizza and I love burgers. This limited time promo caught my eye and I just had to get it. Expectation vs reality though, I was slightly turned off by how salty the two thick pepperoni slices were

If you want a real burger, go downstairs to Gordan Ramsey's joint inside Planet Hollywood. It may be a *bit* pricier and take a little longer, but the overall quality will at least make you feel like you got your money's worth. If all you're looking for a quick snack and a beer, this place will probably do the trick, but don't make it meal. 
--
I've been here twice now and despite its excellent location just inside the main Miracle Mile Shops on the 3rd floor, each visit left me underwhelmed. The best perk the first time around was their 2-for-1 drink special, but this time I forwent the alcohol and just ordered a burger and some fries (both ridiculously overpriced, even for Vegas.) 

The fries came out almost right away, but the burger took about 15 minutes to get to me...even though I could see it sitting there, growing cold and lonely at the window behind the cash wrap.

To their credit, the guy felt awful for forgetting it and offered me a free item from the menu for the wait, but the burger was so off-putting (so much bread...) that I didn't even want to take him up on his offer. In fact, I actually felt nauseous for several hours after eating it. It just wasn't...good. 

Their ketchup selection is pretty fun, so if I was to return, it would be just to order their fries and maybe try a Boozy Milkshake, but that's it.

More of a 3.5 stars, but let's talk some quick tips:

1. The pricing for the burgers do not include fries and a drink. However, you can upgrade any meal for an additional $3.99.

2. At the time of writing this review, they had a deal for $10.00 for a draft beer and their most basic burger.

3. There are MANY different types of ketchup (hence the name!). We tried every single type and we found that we really liked the Garlic ketchup.

4. The drinks that are served here used the new aged drink machines that offer many different choices!

5. The patties cannot be cooked to medium rare!

This place is located very close to the parking lot near the back of Planet Hollywood. I had no idea how very new this place was. A few of my friends and I were walking down and through the Miracle Mile shops and saw this place and decided to give it a try.

My girlfriend and I tried the Western Burger. It was basically a burger with bacon, cheese, and barbecue sauce. For the burger, we felt that the meat didn't seem to be seasoned enough. In fact, the barbecue sauce seemed to be very overpowering. The bacon was standard bacon that you could probably find in most restaurant burgers.

We also ordered the combo fries meal. The fries were pretty standard stuff, nothing really extraordinary. Just normal fries. The portion were good for sharing with another person. I think the star though is their different types of ketchup. We tried garlic ketchup, sriracha ketchup, hickory ketchup and, balsamic ketchup. They also offered Ranch as well as Fries sauce. By far, our favorite was the garlic ketchup. The rest of the different ketchups seem to not really vary in taste. What I mean is that the ketchup doesn't seem to add or subtract from the extra ingredient--sriracha ketchup tastes like sriracha, but a tiny bit sweeter.

The best part of the combo was the drink selection. They have the new coke machines with the multiple combinations. I tried peach flavored sprite! As for service, you order at the counter and then they bring you your food, not really much but they were pretty friendly.

All in all, the only problem I have with this place is that it seems pretty forgettable. When you have one of the best sandwich spots in Vegas just a few short minutes away (Earl's Sandwich), then you got to make your food really memorable. Still it is relatively cheap when compared to other Vegas options, and the lines are not out the door.

Still, I hope you try this new business out and let them know what you think!

Good, but not great. 
Ketchup is a burger place that is good, but potentially could be great. First time I went, I had the breakfast burger. Patty was good, not top shelf and for a bacon connoisseur like me, they certainly could've stepped up their bacon game. Overall good, but a little lacking. 
I also recently discovered that they have a BOGO on hot dogs on Tuesday so I decided to give that a whirl one day. I had the crunch dog and the Vegas dog. The Vegas dog was basically a Costco hot dog with all the toppings, so good but  definitely not worth 7.50 but the crunch dog was a step up. It comes with bacon and onion crunch. As noted earlier, the bacon game needs to step up. This might sound weird but the onion crunch was too crunchy I don't know whether it's pre made or if the chef fries it but it was waaaay too crunchy. Less is more folks. 
Two things this place has going for it: location is perfect. It's right by the parking garage when you enter so they'll always have foot traffic. It's actually why I even tried them in the first place: I was heading home and hungry so I decided to try them out. 
The second thing they have going for them is their ketchup. I haven't even had the whole spectrum but I had the sriracha ketchup and the hickory ketchup and I loved them. That's something that I give them major props for that. 
Where I think they can improve is customer service. The staff always gives the impression of basically sleepwalking anytime I go there, maybe i just have bad luck. 
Another area of improvement would be to promote all the ketchup. Literally nobody that works there ever told me about them; I only discovered it accidentally when I wanted to get some ketchup for my friends fries. It would've been great to have been told about it, or possibly even given the option to have swapped out the regular ketchup for one of those on my hot dogs. It would've made a world of difference 
Overall, I think its ok but I'm not really in any rush to go back

I swore Id never go back and against my better judgement I did.  OMG, Stay away, even with a groupon.  We just came into town, it was about 800F outside and we ran into the Tervis store to pick something up.  We bit the bullet and ate here.  I thought " Oh, I'll get a salad".  10.00 for lettuce, a few slices of onion and croutons with a very salty chicken breast.  It was like a salt lick, so, so bad.  I sent it back and got a grilled cheese.  2 slices of white bread with processed cheese slices.  Ate half, gave the rest to a homeless dude.  Onion rings were ok, kinda greasy.  Wife got a hotdog for 7.00.  This is Sysco food, straight off the truck.  Never again( and I mean it this time).

I wanted to rate a two. Hubs insisted on giving a three so 3 it is... 
We did not have the correct answer to the troll-like cashiers riddle as she was just grumpy and like a lump on a log, she should definitely work somewhere without customer interaction. The man that delivered the food had a peppy personality and seemed like he actually worked there - small Saving grace for the place
Soda machine somehow broke while eating
Even with the slight buzz from the tasty strong spiked shake, the food was still dry and hard to choke down. Blue burger wasn't very "blue"- luckily I was able to sneak the blue cheese of the hubs buffalo fries 
Hubs morning burger was -in his words- edible. Fries were crispy
Several ketchup flavors but nothing to ever bring us back. 
$60 for two to eat at an order yourself burger place?....I'll certainly keep walking by next time
Thanks groupon!

We had just got into town and were actually headed to BurGR, Gordan Ramsay's restaurant, which was on the other side of where we were and we were both STARVING, so we decided to eat here...what a pleasant surprise!  It was DELISH!  They had a bunch of choices from burgers to fries to the ketchup!  Different flavors, the hickory flavored one was our favorite!  The burgers were huge and juicy.  The onion rings were to die for!  Cooked perfectly!  The service was OK, the girl behind the bar was more interested in talking with her friend then serving us.  We will def be back here at some point!
